title: red_sun
body:
A [[red circle]] is drawn mainly in the background of Japanese [[new year|New Year's greetings]]. It is sometimes depicted in combination with [[Mount Fuji]] or [[crane (animal)|cranes]] .

The background of Japanese [[new year|New Year's greetings]] is painted in red and white. 
The reason “red” and “white” are used in [[new year|New Year's greetings]] is because they have been considered auspicious colors since ancient times. 
Red means “vitality” or “protection from evil,” and white means ‘purity’ or “beginning.” 
The combination of these two colors is considered an appropriate color for life celebrations and New Year's festivities.

It should be noted that the real [[sun]] is sometimes depicted in bright red as a sign of unsettling events, but this tag does not represent the [[sun]] at [[sunrise]] or [[sunset]]. 

h4. See also

* [[new year]] 
* [[sun]]
* [[sunrise]]
* [[sunset]]

title: harley_quinn_(suicide_squad_isekai)
body:
[[Harley Quinn]] from the 2024 Japanese animated television series [[Suicide Squad Isekai]], based on the DC Comics Suicide Squad characters. She is one of the main co-stars. 

Amanda Waller, director of A.R.G.U.S., sends a team consisting of dangerous criminals Harley Quinn, Clayface, Deadshot, Peacemaker and King Shark on a mission to another world of magic and monsters. Joined by A.R.G.U.S. agent Rick Flag, this "Suicide Squad" is tasked with assisting a kingdom in battling against not only mythical creatures but also other super-villains that were sent to the other world before them. If they fail to complete their mission in time or attempt to flee, bombs installed in their bodies will blow up.

The opening theme song is "Another World" composed by Tomoyasu Hotei, while the ending theme song is "Go-Getters" performed by Hololive-affiliated VTuber [[Mori Calliope]].

Use this tag to refer specifically to this version of the character.

title: jealous
body:
The desire to retain something that is perceived to belong to oneself - generally held to be possessions, but on this site largely pertains to the affections and intimacy of another person.

Not to be confused with [[envy]], which is the explicit or implicit desire to possess something that someone else has.

[[Touhou]] artists often use [[paru paru]] as the [[sound effects|onomatopoeia]] for jealousy, after [[Mizuhashi Parsee]].

title: skyscraper
body:
A large, continuously habitable [[building]] with multiple floors. In modern sources, the height of a skyscraper is defined as being at least 100 meters or 150 meters, but there is no universally accepted definition. Historically, when these types of buildings began to be built in the 1880s, the term first referred to buildings of 10 to 20 stories. Skyscrapers include [[office]]s, [[hotel]]s, residential space, and retail space.

h4. Notable skyscrapers

title: three-tone_hair
body:
Multicolored hair that consists of three distinct colors.

The division between the three colors may be an immediate change from one to the other or it may be done in a gradient, in which case the gradient hair tag would also apply.

If a character has three hair colors that are split vertically at the top of the head, then fall such that the color hair colors form two distinct sections, then the split-color hair tag would also apply.

title: aurora
body:
A natural atmospheric phenomenon that causes a pattern of colorful lights to appear in the [[night sky]].

Predominantly seen in high-latitude regions around the Arctic and Antarctic. Also known as the [b]northern lights[/b] or [b]aurora borealis[/b] in the Northern hemisphere and as the [b]southern lights[/b] or [b]aurora australis[/b] in the Southern hemisphere.

title: nitori_shuuichi
body:
One of the central characters of [[Hourou Musuko]]. She is a teenage transgender girl, who is able to present as female throughout childhood due to her androgynous appearance. However, as puberty begins, she is less able to dress femininely without consequences.

One day, she works up the courage to wear a female uniform to school, which disgusts her classmates and causes them to ridicule her and call her a pervert.

Despite puberty making it increasingly harder for her to present as female, she still knows deep down that she wants to, and [spoilers]eventually confesses to her girlfriend that she wants to transition to female. Anna accepts her, knowing that this is what's right for Shuichi.[/spoilers]

She eventually takes on the female name Yuri (or Lily, in English).

title: hourou_musuko
body:
[b]Hourou Musuko[/b] is a manga by [[shimura_takako|Shimura Takako]]. Original run: 2002–2013. There is also a 2011 TV anime adaptation.

The English-language version of the manga is running under the title [i]Wandering Son[/i] since 2011. Some western sources have used the unofficial title [i]Transient Son[/i].

Themes include various transgender-related topics from youth perspective, facing puberty, human relations of late childhood and adolescence, school life, and the Japanese teen [[idol|idols]]/modeling culture.

h4. Characters

h6. Protagonists

* [[Nitori Shuuichi]]
* [[Takatsuki Yoshino]]

h6. Classmates and friends at school

* [[Ariga Makoto]]
* [[Chiba Saori]]
* [[Doi Shinpei]]
* [[Oka Takanori]]
* [[Sarashina Chizuru]]
* [[Sasa Kanako]]
* [[Shirai Momoko]]

h6. Others

* [[Maiko (hourou_musuko)|]], a popular teen idol admired by Maho (see below)
* [[Ninomiya Fumiya]], Saori's acquaintance from the local Christian community
* [[Nitori Maho]], Shuuichi's big sister
* [[Seya Riku]], Maho's classmate
* [[Suehiro Anna]], Maiko's friend in the idol circles

h4. See also

title: meteor
body:
A rock or similar object, of any size from a grain of sand to a small moon, descending into a planet's atmosphere, usually while burning up dramatically. If the object can't be identified as anything other than a trail of light in the sky, use the [[shooting star]] tag instead. See forum topic #5294.

Not to be mistaken for a [[comet]], which never enters the Earth's atmosphere.

h4. See also
* [[meteor shower]]
* [[shooting star]]
* [[comet]]
* [[Kamen rider meteor]]
* [[Meteor (company)]]
* [[Meteor (artist)]]
* [[Meteor Games]]
* [[Meteor (Arknights)]]

title: comet
body:
A body usually made up of ice, rock, and dust that orbits a star. 

Forms a trail through space due to solar winds (but [i]usually[/i] not visible with naked eye when viewer is on surface of planet)

Not to be confused with [[meteor]], which enters a planet's atmosphere (and can crash into stuff on the surface if large enough).

h4. See Also:
* [[meteor]]
* [[shooting star]]
* [[contrail]]

title: jo_lolita
body:
A fashion style that combines traditional [[Korean clothes|Korean clothing]] with [[Lolita fashion]]. Jo being short for Joseon, referencing the "Korean Joseon era":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseon].

Jo lolita is esentially a lolita interpretation of the [[hanbok]] (clothes used during Joseon era). Common features are a [[long skirt]] ([[chima (clothes)|]]) and a [[jeogori (clothes)|]]. In a traditional hanbok the jeogori is tucked in, however in jo lolita the skirt (chima) is usually shorter, exposing the jeogori.

h4. Examples

title: sasha_(haguhagu)
body:
Full name, Alexandra Kournikova. An original character created by [[haguhagu_(rinjuu_circus)|haguhagu]]. She is a Russian middle school girl who works as a junior idol in Japan. Originally the main character in several of haguhagu's eromanga, she is now the heroine of the manga series Sasha-chan to Classmate Otaku-kun (the "gone legit" work サーシャちゃんとクラスメイトオタクくん) alongside [[fujihara_(haguhagu)|Fujiwara Kazuki]]. 

This character features in several continuities, where the primary difference between each is the identity of her principal lover.  In all continuities, she is extremely promiscuous, up to and including secretly filming herself having sex so she can masturbate to it later. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], a [[flat chest]], and a [[fang]]. Her hair typically combed to show off her [[forehead]]. Most of her illustrations are suggestive when not explicit and should be tagged [[loli]].

title: lolita_fashion
body:
A Japanese fashion style influenced by [[Victorian]] children's clothing as well as costumes from the [[Rococo movement]].

The fashion consists primarily of a knee length [[skirt]] or [[dress]], [[headdress]], [[blouse]], [[petticoat]]/[[crinoline]], [[kneehighs|knee length socks]] or [[thighhighs|stockings]] and rocking horse or [[high heels|high heel]]/[[platform shoes]]. [[Teddy bear]]s and [[doll]]s are often carried to emphasize the childlike look. 

Please note that [[Lolita fashion]] and [[loli]] are two very different things. [[mature female|Older women]] can be shown wearing these clothes as well.

h4. Substyles

title: grace_mirchea_luslec
body:
Grace Mirchea Luslec (그레이스 미르치아 루슬렉, Geuraeiseu Mireuchia Luseulaek) is Slayer No. 1 and the living "god" of the most dangerous and secretive criminal group, FUG, in the Tower.[1]

Although FUG’s true motives and goals are not clearly known, it is true without a doubt that they exist in the shadows of the Tower, hiding and corrupting. People call Luslec the "God of the Devils" (악마들의 신, Ahkmahdeuleui Shin) or "Demon King" (마왕, Mahwahng; 魔王).[1]

title: autobot
body:
A fictional faction of benevolent sentient [[alien]] [[robot]]s from the planet Cybertron. They are usually the main protagonists in the fictional universe of [[Transformers]]. 

In all but [[transformers_shattered_glass|one Transformer story]], the "Heroic [b]Autobots[/b]" are opposed by the "Evil [[Decepticon]]s", their main antagonists in Transformers. 

Both Autobots and Decepticons are sentient humanoid [[alien]] robots that can transform into machines, vehicles and other familiar mechanical objects. They are typically represented by the red facial insignia they all wear. Primarily, Autobots have blue eyes, while their enemy Decepticons have red eyes. 

Autobots often turn into regular cars, trucks, or other road vehicles but some are aircraft, military vehicles, communication devices, weapons, and cyborg animals. Some can even transform into humans; they'd be classified as pretenders. Most of the Autobot groups' names have the suffix "-bot" in them. 

In [[Japan]], the Autobots are called [b]Cybertrons[/b] (サイバトロン, Saibatoron?) except in the live-action film series and Transformers Animated, where they are referred to as Autobots (オートボット, Ōtobotto?). The [i]Maximals[/i] from Transformers: Beast Wars are also known as Cybertrons in Japan, but in North America they are called Maximals and are descendants of the Autobots. In [[Italy]], they are called [b]Autorobots[/b]. The Autobot symbol is also referred to as an "Autobrand" in issue #14 of the Marvel Comics series. 

In the Michael Bay live action films as well as in the new CGI animated series (Transformers Prime), the title Autobots is explained to be the short version of the title [b]Auto[/b]nomous Ro[b]bot[/b]ic Organism[b]s[/b]. 

h4.Known Autobots 

* [[Optimus Prime]] 
** [[Orion Pax]]
* [[Rodimus Prime]] 
* [[Sentinel Prime]] 
* [[Omega Prime]] 
* [[Hot Rod (transformers)|]] 
* [[jazz_(transformers)|Jazz]]

title: roxanne_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Roxanne[/b], known as [b]Tsutsuji[/b] (ツツジ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rse|Ruby and Sapphire]][/i].

An honors student at the Trainers' School and a proud, skillful Gym Leader, she loves Rock—type Pokémon and fossils. Her signature Pokémon is [[Probopass]].

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] worn in [[twintails]]. She wears a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]], a [[grey dress]], [[pink pantyhose]], and [[shoes]].

h4. Official Art
* !post #1736263: [[pokemon oras|ORAS]]

title: solgaleo_(radiant_sun)
body: A temporary appearance change that [[Solgaleo]] undergoes when either travelling through Ultra Space or using its signature [[pokemon move|moves]], [[Sunsteel Strike (pokemon)|]] and [[Searing Sunraze Smash (pokemon)|]]. In this state, its [[third eye]] opens, and its body [[glowing|glows]] a pale yellow.

title: lunala_(full_moon)
body: A temporary appearance change that [[Lunala]] undergoes when either travelling through Ultra Space or using its signature [[pokemon move|moves]], [[Moongeist Beam (pokemon)|]] and [[Menacing Moonraze Maelstrom (pokemon)|]]. In this state, its [[third eye]] opens, and its wings [[glowing|glow]] blue.

title: black_kyurem_(overdrive)
body: The appearance [[Black Kyurem]] assumes while in battle. In this state, sections of its tail, right arm, and right horn give off an [[electricity|electric]] blue [[glowing|glow]], and four [[tube]]s sprout from its back and connect to its tail.

title: white_kyurem_(overdrive)
body: The appearance [[White Kyurem]] assumes while in battle. In this state, sections of its tail and fur give off a [[fire|fiery]] red [[glowing|glow]], and four [[tube]]s sprout from its back and connect to its tail.

title: zun_(style)
body:
[[ZUN (artist)|]]'s style of drawing. Known for its simplicity and roundness; often described as cute with a tendency to have textures for clothing patterns rather than manually drawn ones.

title: zero_ii_(kyokugen_dasshutsu)
body:
The main antagonist of [[Zero Escape: Toki no Dilemma]]. [spoiler]Their true identity is [[Delta (kyokugen Dasshutsu)|]].[/spoiler]

Wears a [[black hat|black]], [[wide brim|wide-brimmed hat]], a [[plague doctor mask]], a [[black cloak]], a [[butterfly pin]], and [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] with [[fake claws|claws]]. Often seen with a [[staff]] in hand.

Not to be confused with:
* [[Zero (Kyokugen Dasshutsu)|]], the main antagonist of [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu: 9 Jikan 9 Nin 9 no Tobira]].
* [[Zero III]], a character from [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu ADV: Zennin Shibou Desu]].
* [[Zero Two (Darling In The Franxx)|]], a character from [[Darling in the Franxx]].
* [[Zero Two (Kirby)|0²]], a character from [[kirby 64|Kirby 64: The Crystal Shards]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #9542858

h4. External links

title: cheek_covers
body: A bit of armor or fabric that covers only a character's cheeks, and may or may not cover their chin as well. It does not cover their mouth, or it would be a [[mask]].

title: winx_club
body:
An Italian magical girl inspired animated series co-produced by Rainbow SpA and later [[Nickelodeon]]. It was created and directed by Iginio Straffi.

It is notable for its many Fairy Forms or Fairy Transformations, different power levels that fairies can attain as an extension of their magical abilities.

It received a [[winx club (reboot)|reboot]] in 2025.

body: A [[minigame]] in [[Fate/Hollow Ataraxia]].

title: zero_two_(darling_in_the_franxx)
body:
[[DARLING in the FRANXX]] character and its deuteragonist. Nickname is based on her designation as "Code:002". Has [[pink hair]], [[green eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and has [[small horns|small]] [[red horns]]. Usually wears a [[white hairband]].

Along with [[Hiro_(darling_in_the_franxx)|]], the pair pilot the Franxx [[Strelizia]].

She is voiced by [[Tomatsu Haruka]].

Not to be confused with [[zero two (kirby)|0²]] from [[Kirby 64]] or [[Zero II (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]] from [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu]].

body:
A character introduced in [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu ADV: Zennin Shibou Desu]]. He is an AI created by [spoiler][[Sigma (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]][/spoiler] that resembles an anthropomorphic white [[rabbit]].

Not to be confused with [[Zero (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]], the antagonist of the [[kyokugen dasshutsu: 9 jikan 9 nin 9 no tobira|previous game]], or [[Zero II (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]], the antagonist of the [[zero escape: toki no dilemma|following game]].

title: delta_(kyokugen_dasshutsu)
body:
A character from [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu]], introduced in [[Zero Escape: Toki no Dilemma]]. An [[old man]] with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]], [[wrinkled skin]], and [[purple eyes]] with [[black sclera]]e. Wears a [[blue sweater|blue]] [[turtleneck sweater]] with [[long sleeves]], [[brown pants]], [[blue shoes]], and [[round eyewear|round]] [[sunglasses]] with [[red-tinted eyewear|red lenses]] and a [[yellow-framed eyewear|yellow frame]].

[spoiler]The true identity of [[Zero II (Kyokugen Dasshutsu)|]], the main antagonist of the game and the overarching antagonist of the entire series. Also known as [[Q (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]].[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

title: q_(kyokugen_dasshutsu)
body:
A character introduced in [[Zero Escape: Toki no Dilemma]]. A member of “Q-Team” alongside [[Eric (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]] and [[Mira (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]]. He is a young boy with a large, round [[helmet]] covering his whole head. The helmet is [[rust|rusted]], and has a large [[crack]] that vaguely resembles a mouth.

Wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] with purple [[striped shirt|stripes]], [[grey overalls]], [[kneehighs|knee-high]] [[blue socks]], and [[brown shoes]]. He also has a [[bandaid on knee|bandaid on his left knee]].

[spoiler]The player is misled to believe his name is Q, which in reality is an alias used by [[Delta (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]]. His true identity is Sean, an [[android]] created by Delta. What looks like a helmet is actually his head.[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance
* !post #9542819

h4. External links
* "Zero Escape Wiki":[https://zeroescape.fandom.com/wiki/Sean]

title: hori_susumu
body: Protagonist of [[Mr. Driller]]

title: ari_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. She becomes the deuteragonist for some of the routes featured in [b]The Re 'Up[/b].

Ari is a timid and reserved girl who struggles with various issues such as [[self-harm]], depression, and her closeted feelings towards other girls, stemming from her fears of her orientation being known by the school. In some routes, she can enter a rather unhealthy relationship with [[Nicole (class of 09)|]].

title: irene_(kanniiepan)
body: [[kanniiepan]]'s [[original]] character.

title: eric_(kyokugen_dasshutsu)
body:
A character introduced in [[Zero Escape: Toki no Dilemma]]. A member of "Q-Team" alongside [[Q (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]] and [[Mira (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]].

body:

This tag is not mutually exclusive with [[self-harm]], but requires the evidence of non-recent self-harm (ex. bloodied cuts do not count).

title: bianca_(path_to_nowhere)
body: A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]], introduced in the event Perfect Vote and the central story character of the event. Voiced by [[Hasegawa Ikumi]]. An S rank Sinner, brave, cheery and energetic, Bianca is an investigative journalist of DisTV News on the Eastside district of DisCity, also known by her online username Extra-Rich Apple Juice. Her alignment is Pestilence. Bianca has [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]], her hair style is an [[updo]] held together by a [[black hairband]], decorated with [[apple hair ornament|apple]], [[cherry hair ornament|cherry]], [[strawberry hair ornament|strawberry]] and [[blueberry hair ornament]]s, her eyes as [[slit pupils]]. Has a [[snake tattoo]] on her left [[shoulder tattoo|shoulder]]. She wears a [[crop top|cropped]] [[black tank top]] and [[white pants]], left leg of her pants has a [[thigh cutout]], a [[white coat]] in a [[off shoulder]] manner, and a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[open-toe shoes|toeless shoes]]. Wears two [[chain necklace]]s and an [[ID card]] on a [[lanyard]], often seen holding both a recording [[camera]] and a [[can]] of apple juice. h4. Appearance * !asset #22156107: Mugshot * !asset #22156108: Default * !asset #22156109: Phase 3 h4. External links * "S1N Wiki: Bianca":[https://s1n.gg/sinner/bianca]

title: stargazer_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]]. Voiced by Noguchi Ruriko.

An S rank Sinner, a travelling fortune teller of the White Sands, otherwise known by her real name <spoiler>Anarkia</spoiler>. Her alignment is Heresy.

Stargazer has [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], her eyes are canonically violet purple, but can either be depicted as [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[purple eyes|purple]] by artists. She has [[low-tied long hair|low-tied]] [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]], her hair is [[parted hair|parted]] into two halves, each tied by a [[hair belt]]. Has gold [[body markings]] on her stomach, waist and thighs.

She wears a [[open jacket|open]] [[hooded jacket|hooded]] [[white jacket]] with [[winged headwear|wings ornament]] on the hood, a [[green tube top]], [[white pants|white]] [[baggy pants]] with [[hip vent]]s and [[knee cutout]]s, and a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[open-toe shoes|toeless]] shoes.

title: aoba_chika
body:
A character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]].

h4. Appearance

Her [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] is [[parted hair|parted in the middle]], tied into [[low-tied long hair|low]] [[low twintails|twintails]] and decorated with [[white flower|white]] [[hair flower|flowers]]. She also has her [[hair between eyes|bangs between eyes]] and [[blue eyes]].

In her daily life, she wears the [[st._liliana's_academy_school_uniform|Saint Liliana's Academy uniform]] paired with [[white socks|white]] [[socks]].

As a [[Magical Girl]], her hair assumes a [[blue hair|light blue]] tint, and has an [[ahoge]]. She wears a [[head wreath|flower crown]], [[earrings]], a [[striped scarf|striped]] [[blue scarf|blue]] [[scarf]], a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[shirt]] that [[navel cutout|exposes the]] [[navel]], [[long sleeves|long]] [[white sleeves|white]][[two-tone sleeves|-and-]][[black sleeves|black]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]], a [[bandaged leg|bandage]], and a [[vines|vine]] [[vine on leg|on her legs]], and [[blue boots|blue]] [[open-toe boots|toeless]] [[boots]]. She fights with an [[axe]].

body:
The 8th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Hoshimachi Suisei]], revealed on March 15, 2024, it has a 1920s oriental gangster theme and has comes in 2 [[official alternate color|colors]].

It consists of a [[black hat]] or [[white hat]] [[fedora]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[double-breasted]] [[white jacket|white]] or [[black jacket]] worn over a [[black shirt]] with [[gold trim]] and a [[mandarin collar]], a [[long skirt|long]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[zipper skirt]] with a [[side slit]] with either a [[white skirt|white]] to [[blue skirt|blue]] or [[black skirt|black]] to [[red skirt|red]] [[gradient skirt|gradient]], [[white boots|white]] or [[black boots|black]] [[open-toe boots|toeless]] [[zipper footwear|zipper]] [[platform boots]] with [[belt boots|belts]], she also has optional [[red-tinted eyewear|red]] or [[blue-tinted eyewear|blue]] [[round eyewear]] [[sunglasses]] and  [[official alternate eye color|her eyes can turn red now]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume is a [[long hair]] in a [[low ponytail]] [[hair over shoulder|hanging over her shoulder]] with [[swept bangs|swept]] [[asymmetrical bangs]].

title: aika_himena
body:
A character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. She is the leader of Neo-Magius, an organization claiming Magical Girl Supremacy.

h4. Appearance

She has [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] with [[blunt ends]], [[hair between eyes|bangs between her eyes]] and [[purple eyes]].

In her daily life, she has her hair tied into a [[half updo]], and wears the [[Kamihama Future Academy school uniform]] paired with [[earrings]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]].

As a [[Magical Girl]], her hair is tied into a [[bow-shaped hair|bow]], and she wears a [[sleeveless kimono|sleeveless]] [[purple kimono|purple]] [[kimono]] [[cropped kimono|crop top]], [[long sleeves|long]] [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[furisode]] with a [[floral print|floral]] [[print sleeves|print]], a [[red ribbon|red]] and [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[ribbon]] tied into a [[flower knot]], a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[purple skirt|purple]]/[[white skirt|white]] [[miniskirt]] decorated with a [[purple gemstone]], an [[anklet]] and [[brown boots|brown]] [[open-toe boots|toeless]] [[boots]]. She also has [[stomach tattoo|stomach]] and [[leg tattoo]]s, and fights with a [[pink shawl|pink]] [[hagoromo]].

title: zinnia_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Zinnia[/b], known as [b]Higana[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon oras|Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire]][/i].

This mysterious Trainer journeyed throughout the Hoenn region to carry out her mission as the Lorekeeper of the Draconid people. She is often seen with a [[Whismur]] nicknamed [b]Aster[/b], known as [b]Shigana[/b] (シガナ) in Japan.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[black hair]]. She wears [[earrings]], a [[cloak]], a [[black shirt]], [[grey shorts|grey]] [[short shorts]] with a [[red belt|red]] [[rope belt]], [[grey thighhighs|grey]] [[over-kneehighs]], a mega [[anklet]], and [[open-toe boots|open-toed]] [[grey boots]].

title: langley_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the USS [i]Langley[/i] (CVL-27).

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[purple hair]] with [[hair ornament]]s that represent her real-life hull blisters, a blue [[hair ribbon]], [[blue eyes]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]], [[pencil skirt]] with [[side slit]] and her hull number, [[garter straps]], and [[rudder footwear|rudder-propeller]] [[thighhighs]]. She also wields a [[Winchester Model 1897]] [[shotgun]].

She starts out as her original US Navy [i]Independence[/i]-class form, with her [[rigging]] consisting of her real-life flight deck split in two, a catapult, her two funnels at the back and her 76 mm AA single mounts. Her kai form add her hull number to her now combined flight deck and SK [[radar]] to her right, while her funnels are reduced to two and her 76 mm AA single mounts are replaced by two [[Bofors 40 mm gun|40 mm quad AA mounts]]. Her rifle now also has a [[bayonet]] attached.

She was transferred to France in the post-war period as [i]La Fayette[/i], named in honor of the [[Marquis de Lafayette]].

Character design by [[Zeco]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5622837: Base
* !post #5622833: Kai

body:

She is portrayed with [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs]] in [[twin braids]], and [[blue eyes|blue]]/[[green eyes]]. Her default outfit is her class' uniform: a [[sleeveless]] [[serafuku]] that exposes her [[midriff]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], dark [[blue necktie]], [[white gloves]], [[black belt]], [[rudder footwear]], and [[asymmetrical legwear]] where the left leg has a [[single thighhigh]] stocking on a [[garter_straps|garter strap]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, two hull pieces containing her three real-life 15.2 twin gun mounts with a [[joystick]] control, an 8 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount on her right [[rudder footwear|rudder boot]], and her [[flight deck]] on the left boot.

title: richard_p._leary_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the [i]Fletcher[/i]-class destroyer USS [i]Richard P. Leary[/i], named after a naval officer and rear Admiral who served from the [[American Civil War]] through the Spanish-American War. Like her sister ship the [[Heywood L. Edwards (Kancolle)|]], Leary survived World War II and was transferred to be a vessel in the new [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]], where she was given the name [i]Yūgure[/i]. The vessel was returned to the United States in 1974, and scrapped two years later. Designed by [[Zeco]], and first made available in-game in May, 2025.

In Kancolle, Richard P. Leary has short, [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[medium breasts]] like her sisters. She wears a white [[dixie cup hat]], white [[elbow gloves]], colored [[serafuku]] with a [[black sailor collar]], a [[black skirt]], and [[black thighhighs]] under her armored greaves. Like her sister ship [[Heywood L. Edwards (Kancolle)|]], Leary at base wears a [[grey dress]] in a camouflage scheme, that changes to a [[blue dress]] similar to the rest of the Fletcher class at Kai. Also at Kai, Leary gains a bronze and a silver [[star (symbol)|]] on her collar akin to her sister [[Johnston (Kancolle)|]], symbolizing the six Battle Stars awarded to the historical vessel for her wartime service. 

Leary's [[rigging]] comes in multiple pieces: two hull sections attached to each leg hold racks of depth charges, with the section on her left side also mounting her fire-control director and [[radar]]. Another section attaches to her back, splitting off and holding one [[smokestack]] and one five-inch gun mount to either side. Leary's damaged art shows this section also contains a platform at the small of her back for a twin [[Bofors 40 mm Gun]] mount. She carries a third five-inch gun mount in a separate slung weapon similar to the rest of the Fletcher class. Leary's rigging does not change between Base and Kai; rather, Base is colored in a camouflage paint scheme, while Leary Kai's rigging is colored in the "Measure 22":[https://www.shipcamouflage.com/measure_22.htm] paint scheme, with layers of red, blue, and grey color. 

While a new Fletcher with some resemblance to Richard P. Leary's design (and wearing a yellow bikini almost identical to what would later be revealed as Leary's swimsuit skin) was teased by Zeco in the "2024 Kancolle Calendar":[/posts/7036375], Leary's first true introduction was during the 12th Anniversary Lawson collaboration during the Spring 2025 Event. She made it into the game proper once that event had come to a close. 

h4. Appearance

title: lance_of_longinus_(evangelion)
body:
An [[alien]] weapon in the [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]] series.

In the Gospel of John, an unnamed soldier, known traditionally as Longinus, pierced [[Jesus]]'s side with his spear to ensure he was dead. The account given in John purports that blood and water (cf. 1 John 5:6-8) came immediately (John 19:34). Relics purported to be the spear with which Longinus pierced Jesus have appeared since the sixth century.

The manga/anime series [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]] depicts the Spear of Longinus as a colossal [[bident]] and as the only object that can penetrate the [[at_field|A.T. Field]] of an [[angel_(evangelion)|Angel]]. [spoilers]It is revealed later in the series that the lance was built by the same advanced aliens who created the Angels as a way to control them.[/spoilers]

h4. See also
* [[Heavy spear (Evangelion)|]]
* [[Spear of Cassius]]
* [[Spear of Gaius]]

h4. External links

* "EvaWiki: Spear of Longinus":[https://wiki.evageeks.org/Spear_of_Longinus]
* "Evangelion Wiki: Spear of Longinus":[https://evangelion.fandom.com/wiki/Spear_of_Longinus]
* "Catholic Encyclopedia: The Holy Lance":[http://www.newadvent.org/cathen/08773a.htm]
* "Wikipedia: Holy Lance":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holy_Lance]
other_names: ロンギヌスの槍(エヴァ)

title: mechagodzilla
body:
A giant [[mecha]]nical copy of [[Godzilla]] first appeared in [i][[Godzilla vs. Mechagodzilla]][/i]. Being one of the most well-known [[kaiju]] of the series.

In many of its subsequent appearance, it was created by the Earth Defense Force using the bones of the original Godzilla that made a landfall on Japan in 1950s, and to be used to fight against various kaijus, including other Godzillas.

title: malaysian_secondary_school_uniform
body: [[School uniform]]s worn in secondary schools in [[Malaysia]] (equivalent to high schools, as Malaysia's education system is inherited as a legacy of the former British colonial rule) Female students have the choice of either two uniforms: Pinafore - a turquoise pinafore [[skirt]] worn over a [[white blouse]], paired with either [[white socks|white]]/[[black socks]] in white/black shoes. [[Baju kurung]] - based on the traditional Malay outfit for women. Consists of the [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] shirt called the "baju", followed by a turquoise [[long skirt]]. Paired with either white/black socks in white/black shoes. Also paired with a [[hijab]], which is commonly worn by the Muslim students. Non-Muslims can also sometimes wear this type of uniform. Color of the "baju" depends on the student's role - most are white, some are blue to indicate prefects (as it is standard for prefects to wear blue), and some are other colors, such as green or yellow, which the student wears if they are involved in co-curricular activities. h4. External links * "Wikipedia: School uniforms in Malaysia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/School_uniforms_in_Malaysia]

title: scouter
body:
A small, single-lens eyepiece that is worn wrapped around the side of the head, its name here originating from [[Dragon Ball Z]]. The device typically sports a [[heads-up display]] that provides its wearer with statistics or information on their surroundings, similar to a [[head-mounted display]]. Its most well-known feature, however, is its ability to calculate the power level of any living being, and displayed the result as a number.

Not to be confused with the [[monocle]], another single-lens eyepiece used expressly for correcting vision like [[glasses]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8739400
* !post #9539918

h4. See also

* [[It's over 9000 (meme)|]]

title: reversed_front
body:
A Taiwanese, anti-CCP [[propaganda]], turn-based strategy game. Players may either choose one faction among [[Hong Kong]], [[Tibet]], [[uygur|Uyghurs]], [[Kazakhstan]], [[Mongolia]], [[Manchukuo]], [[Taiwan]], and Cathaysian Rebels to fight against [[China]], or play as China against all other factions. Available for Android and iOS, with an upcoming [[steam (platform)|Steam]] release.

According to the developers, this game is a work of non-fiction, and any similarity to actual agencies, policies or ethnic groups of China in this game is intentional.

title: teddy_(pgr)
body:
Teddy, otherwise known as <spoiler>Christina Norman</spoiler> is a character from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], at first she was a NPC debuted during 'A New Divide' patch, and now a playable character. She is a Construct in service to Babylonia's Engineering Force, a colleague of [[Karenina (pgr)|]], the two often bicker with each other, but usually it ends in Teddy's favour. Voiced by [[Senbongi Sayaka]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair|pink]] [[straight hair]] and [[pink eyes]], wears a [[headgear]] resembling a pair of [[headphones]], both of her arms are [[mechanical arms|mechanical]] and she wears a [[metal collar]] on her neck.

Her apparels includes an innerwear [[bodysuit]] and a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[lab coat]] that is usually left [[open coat|open]].

title: lamia_(pgr)
body:
Playable character and boss encounter in [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. Voiced by [[Gotou Saori]].

A member of [[Luna (PGR)|]]'s faction of Ascendants. Lamia is known to be exceptionally timid yet also cowardly, trying to avoid as much conflict with her peers and blending into the background as much as possible (including literally due to her camouflaging capabilities). Lamia's origin traces back to an underwater research site for a Zero Point Reactor, carrying the last wishes of the base's staff before their death due to a breach by the Punishing Virus.

title: kamen_rider_imperer
body:
One of the 13 riders in [[Kamen Rider Ryuki (Series)|]].
Transformed by [[Sano Mitsuru (Kamen Rider)|]]. 
He has strong legs and excels in a [[kicking|kick]]-based fighting style similar to [[Muay Thai]].
He contracted with [[Gigazelle]]. Because Gigazelle have a habit of herding with their own kind, the Imperer can also have Gigazelle companions under his command.

h4. List of Advent Cards he owns
* Advent: Summons Gigazelle.
* Spin Vent: Summons [b][[GazelleStab]][/b], the [[shield]] with a pair of [[drill]]s.
* Final Vent: The special move, [b]Drive Divider[/b], is activated. He has his Gigazelles [[ramming|charge]] at the target in rapid succession, before finishing it off with a flying [[kneeing]].

title: king_k._rool
body:
Main antagonist of the [i][[Donkey Kong (series)|]][/i] series, introduced in the original [i][[Donkey Kong Country]][/i]. He is the leader of the Kremlings, a race of [[crocodilian]]s that constantly antagonize [[Donkey Kong]] and the Kong Family. 

His most distinctive physical trait is his single [[bloodshot_eyes|bloodshot eye]]. In his default [b]King[/b] persona he dons a gold [[crown]], a [[red cape]] with a [[brooch]], and golden [[bracer]]s. However he is known to adopt other personas such as [b]Kaptain K. Rool[/b] where he wears a [[pirate]] look with a [[pirate hat]] carrying a [[blunderbuss]], [b]Baron K. Roolenstein[/b] where he adopts a [[mad scientist]], [[frankenstein's_monster|frankenstein]]-like look with a [[lab coat]], and [b]King Krusha K. Rool[/b] where he takes on the look of a boxer with [[boxing gloves]] and a [[championship belt]]. 

His name is a pun on "cruel". Colloquially it is commonly pronounced as "King Kay Rool" in English speaking countries as well as officially in [i][[Super Smash Bros.]] Ultimate[/i]. The television show usually pronounced his name as "King Kuh Rool". In Japanese it's pronounced as "King Cruel".

h4. Appearance
* !post #3217762: Default
* !asset #25563218: Kaptain K. Rool
* !asset #25563220: Baron K. Roolenstein
other_names: キング"クラッシャー"クルール

title: gigazelle
body:
A type of [[antelope]]-type monster that appears in [[Kamen Rider Ryuki (Series)|]].
They appeared in large numbers, one of which contracted with [[Kamen Rider Imperer]].
They are characterized by their quick movements, high jumping ability, two drill-shaped horns, and blades on their forearms. Some of them possess [[sasumata]].

title: kiryu_coco
body:
A former [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[holoforce|4th generation]]. A [[dragon girl]] in human form. Designed by [[Yaman]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[orange hair]] with a single [[blonde hair|yellow]] [[streaked hair|lock of hair]] near her forehead. Her regular hairstyle is [[straight hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[hair intakes]] held with a [[black hairband]], [[fanged bangs|fanged]] [[blunt bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and a [[side braid]]. She also has a pair of [[dragon horns]] with a [[horn bow|bow]] on her right horn, [[pointy ears]], [[red eyes]] with [[white pupils|white]] [[slit pupils]], a long purple [[dragon tail]] (which she had a running gag of it being a [[butt plug]] [[anal tail|tail]]). She also has quite [[large breasts]], with her subsequent outfits making them [[huge breasts|noticeably larger]].

She is fluent in English, and quite eccentric (due to being a half-American). Hosted a morning "news show"-esque 20-minute program on weekdays named "AsaCoco" (Morning Coco), which usually ended up creating absurd memes - such as [[Himemori Luna]]'s English Corner, where the cute, childish princess constantly spews out obscenities, and most notably the drug "[[asacoco]]", a potent stimulant available to be delivered in a wide variety of forms ranging from needles to anal plugs.

Despite her wild antics, insane gags and frequent foul language (which often got her into trouble with YouTube), she is very eager to help her friends if need be and has a mature, big sister-like approach to troublesome situations (though usually laced with some of her personal brand of humor to break the seriousness if it's too much).

She was considered to have the second largest bust in hololive after [[Tsukumo Sana]], even toppling [[Shirogane Noel]]'s K-night cups. She was also significantly taller than the rest of the hololive girls (180 cm, compared with [[Omega Alpha]], who is the second tallest at 175 cm without counting the gigantic Sana), especially the rest of the 4th generation (Kanata, Towa and Watame are all about 150 cm tall, Luna is the shortest at 140 cm, boosted to 150 cm with her shoes and crown).

She was the real-life roommate of [[Amane Kanata]], and the apartment that they lived in together was called by other visiting hololive members as the "KanaCoco House". This means that they could (and had several times) make appearances on each other's streams.

She is in fact a big [[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)|]] fangirl and has been known to play games of the series. In fact, her name and her title of "Chairwoman" ("会長" - [i]Kaichou[/i]) are direct references to [[Kiryu Kazuma]].

Kiryu Coco reached one million YouTube subscribers on February 17, 2021.

She announced her graduation from Hololive on June 8, 2021. Her final act was a live concert on July 1, 2021, which became one of the most viewed live streams in Hololive and VTuber history, reaching over 498,000 concurrent viewers.

title: predation
body:
Hunting and killing prey, particularly when done by animals but also sufficiently "feral" humanoid chracters in an animalistic state. For humans hunting with weapons, see [[hunting]]. Primarily done for food but also includes things like cats leaving dead birds. Does not include things like territorial disputes. There must be a clear "hunter and prey" scenerario. 

Includes both in progress hunting and when eating the dead prey.

title: ultra_eye
body:
[[Ultraseven]]'s transformation item, which is a pair of red-trimmed glasses. Also known as the [b]Task-Mask[/b] in the English dub.

As [[Moroboshi Dan]], he can use the Ultra Eye to transform into his Ultra form. It is also prone to getting stolen by [[alien]] invaders, rendering him unable to transform without it, forcing him to call upon his Capsule Monsters.

His son, [[Ultraman Zero]], uses the [[Ultra Zero Eye]], which also functions similarly to his father's Ultra Eye.

* Ultraman Wiki: "Ultra Eye":[https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Ultra_Eye]

title: areola_slip
body:
When one or both areolae slip out of clothing or are partially exposed. The [[nipples]] should not be exposed. Recognizable by a pink or red swell of flesh peeking out beneath the clothes. 

This often happens with very [[revealing clothes]], such as [[slingshot swimsuit]]s or [[micro bikini]]s, or because of a [[wardrobe malfunction]], [[undressing]], a [[shirt lift]], or incomplete [[censored|censorship]]. 

If the [[nipples]] are fully visible, tag [[nipple slip]] instead.

h4. See also
* [[nipple slip]]

title: sunlight
body:
The light of the sun.

[[Sunbeam]] (crepuscular rays) is where light rays stream through gaps in clouds or between other objects. These are columns of sunlit air separated by darker cloud-shadowed regions. (See post #438675)

[[Sunburst]] is for designs or figures of burst of [[sunlight]], but may not necessarily be the actual sun (See post #645306)

For tagging purposes, keep in mind that a particular image may satisfy one or more of the specific terms mentioned above.

h4. See also

* [[dappled sunlight]]
* [[light rays]] 
* [[sunbeam]]
* [[sunburst]]
* [[sun shower]]
* [[lens flare]]

h4. External links

* "Dictionary.com: Sunlight":https://dictionary.reference.com/browse/sunlight
* "Wikipedia: Crepuscular rays":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crepuscular_rays

title: school_uniform
body:
A uniform commonly worn by students of various grades depending on the country; in Japan, they're mostly worn by middle school and high school students. The two most common designs are the [[serafuku]] and [[blazer]].

Common accessories can include: [[sweater]], [[cardigan]], [[sweater vest]], [[thighhighs]], and [[kneehighs]]. A [[gakuran]] is a popular uniform worn by boys. A common footwear for both genders while in school is the [[uwabaki]].

title: sonic_the_hedgehog
body:
One of the most iconic and instantly recognizable figures of pop culture in entertainment. Starring in several cartoons and anime, movies, a hit video game series, and holds the record for the longest running comic book series based from a [[video game]] franchise. 

The main hero of the [[Sonic (series)|]] franchise, [b]Sonic the Hedgehog[/b] is a blue-colored hedgehog who can run at extremely fast speeds, and has a upbeat personality with a smarty-pants attitude while always looking forward to adventures. He loves chili dogs and rock music. He makes friends easily, but will equally not forgive anyone who threatens his friends and the world. His long-time nemesis is [[Dr. Eggman]], but they seem to uphold their rivalry on decent terms. Sonic can also change his form state, by collecting all 7 of the [[Chaos Emerald]]s and harnessing their positive energy to transform into Super Sonic; which bears a striking resemblance to a [[Super Saiyan]] from the [[Dragon Ball Z]] universe. This in turn grants him exponential speed and power increases, among flight abilities also making him immune to most attacks. 

Sonic was designed and created by Japanese artist and game designer "Oshima Naoto":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naoto_%C5%8Cshima. He was initially codenamed "Mr. Needlemouse" during development as Sega's new mascot and was originally colored teal. His trademark blue pigmentation was chosen later to match Sega's cobalt blue logo. "Uekawa Yuji":http://sonic.wikia.com/wiki/Yuji_Uekawa provided the revamping of Sonic The Hedgehog's art style with the shift to the 3D era with the [[Sonic Adventure]] games around 1998.

Sonic replaced [[Alex Kidd (character)|Alex Kidd]] as the official mascot of [[SEGA]] Corporation since 1991.

Voiced by [[Kanemaru Jun'ichi]] in Japan, and [[Jaleel White]], [[Martin Burke]], [[Ryan Drummond]], [[Jason Griffith]], and [[Roger Craig Smith]] in North America.

title: nekomata_okayu_(wonderland)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Nekomata Okayu]].

It's inspired by the [[Cheshire Cat (alice in wonderland)|]] from [[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]] and consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[beret]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] with [[frilled sleeves]] and a [[cleavage cutout]], a [[purple ribbon|purple]] [[neck ribbon]], an optional [[black coat]] with a [[playing card theme]] [[stole]], [[black shorts]] with [[suspenders]]. [[grey socks|grey]], [[purple socks|purple]] and [[black socks|black]] [[striped socks|striped]] [[kneehighs]] held with [[legwear garter]]s and [[black shoes]]. The most peculiar detail of this costume, is a purple [[heart on chest|heart]] [[heart tattoo|tattoo]] [[chest tattoo|right on her cleavage]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has her [[medium hair|medium]]-to-[[long hair]] with a dark [[purple hair|purple]] [[streaked hair|streak]] and either her usual [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[crossed bangs]] or [[swept bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering her left eye]].

title: chibi_usa
body:
The [[pink hair|pink-haired]] character from the series [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] by [[Takeuchi Naoko]]. She is also the future daughter of [[Tsukino Usagi]] and [[Chiba Mamoru]].

When she first appears, she is a small child from the 30th century who visits the past to seek help from the series' primary heroines, the [[Sailor Senshi]]. She later returns, a few years older, in order to train as a Senshi herself — [[Sailor Chibi Moon]].

Note that her full name is [b]Tsukino Usagi[/b], the exact same as her mother's. She is given the nickname [b]Chibi Usa[/b] in order to differentiate between the two Usagis. 'Chibi' means 'small', while 'usa' is the first part of her full name, so it means 'small Usagi'.

Voiced by Araki Kae in the 90s anime, and [[Fukuen Misato]] in Crystal.

h4. See also

* [[Black Lady (sailor Moon)|]]
* [[Small Lady Serenity]]
* [[Super Sailor Chibi Moon]]
* [[Super Sailor Chibi Moon (Stars)]]

title: visor
body:
Ambiguous tag.

* for the armored part of a [[helm]] that can be lifted, see [[visor (armor)]].
* for sun visors or capless hats that only consist of an eyeshade and a strap around the head, see [[visor cap]]
* for the type of cyberpunk-ish visors that are worn like glasses, see [[head-mounted display]]
* for the type of glass/plastic visors incorporated in helmets seen in [[mecha]] or worn by sci-fi characters such as [[Samus Aran]]'s and [[Master Chief]]'s, see [[assault visor]]
* for bulky eyewear, see [[goggles]]
* for ppe that covers the entire face, see [[face shield]] 
* for single-lens eyepiece, see [[scouter]]

title: sunday_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] character, and [[brother and sister|brother]] to [[Robin (Honkai: Star Rail)|]]. Voiced by [[Ootsuka Takeo]] in Japanese. 

He is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[grey hair|grey]]/light [[blue hair]], [[yellow eyes]], [[head wings]], and a [[halo]]. His outfit in his playable version consists of a [[grey shirt]] with a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white cloak]] with a [[hood]], [[earrings]], and [[black shoes]]; but replaces his original white pants with [[black pants|black]] ones, while his gloves also turn [[black gloves|black]]. His thigh belt is now colored [[blue belt|blue]] and is moved to his right leg. 

He is currently residing in the [[Astral Express (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] as a passenger.

title: bren_lmg
body:
The Bren is a series of [[light machine gun]]s made by Britain in the 1930s that would be widely used by British and Commonwealth [[military|forces]] during [[World War II]]. Its distinct features are the top-loading [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]], carry handle and telescoping [[bipod]]. The design was heavily based on the Czechoslovak [[ZB-26]], hence the name "Bren" was derived from [b]Br[/b]no, the manufacturer of the ZB-26, combined with [b]En[/b]field, the manufacturer in the UK.

After World War II, many Bren guns were re-chambered for the 7.62×51mm NATO [[rifle cartridge|round]] in order to accept [[FN FAL|L1]] magazines.

In anime, the Bren is commonly seen being used by [[Perrine H. Clostermann]] in [[Strike Witches]], as well as [[kazusa (blue_archive)|Kazusa]] in [[Blue Archive]].

h4. See also

* [[Bren (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia entry: "Bren light machine gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bren_light_machine_gun

title: standard_manufacturing_dp-12
body:
The [b]DP-12[/b] is a [[bullpup]] 12-gauge [[pump action]] [b][[double-barreled shotgun]][/b] designed by Standard Manufacturing, produced since 2015. It has two tube magazines, each of which feeds its own barrel. Each internal [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] tube can hold up to 7 rounds in total with indicator windows. 

h1. See also

title: sig_mcx
body:
The [b]SIG MCX[/b] is a family of selective fire [[gun]]s designed and manufactured by [[SIG Sauer]]. The civilian legal models are available in semi-auto only. SIG designed the upper receiver to be compatible with standard [[AR-15]] and [[M16]] lower receivers with the help of an adapter.

This tag applies to all the prominent variants, such the original SIG MCX [[assault rifle]], the second generation SIG MCX Virtus, the short-barrelled SIG MCX Rattler, and the multi-caliber SIG MCX Spear (that can be 7.62mm NATO [[battle rifle]]).

h4. See also

* [[SIG MCX (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[SIG MPX]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

title: hakama
body:
Traditional [[Japanese clothes|Japanese clothing]], looking like either a [[pleated skirt]] ([[hakama skirt]]) or baggy, pleated [[pants]] ([[hakama pants]]). A traditional hakama has seven deep pleats, five in the front and two in the rear.

Hakama are split into a front and back section at the top, each of which have ties which are secured around the waist, often with visible [[hip vent]]s and usually covering the midriff. Hakama are worn over a [[kimono]].

Commonly worn both by [[samurai]], [[miko]] and [[kannushi]], practitioners of many martial arts including [[kyuudou]], and often by [[sumo]] wrestlers when appearing in public outside the ring.

Traditionally worn by men with either a [[kataginu]] sleeveless jacket/vest in an outfit known as [i]kamishimo[/i] (lit. upper & lower) or over a formal, long-sleeved [[montsuki]] [[kimono]], with the family crest on it.  Sometimes a [[haori]] is worn over the latter.

Hakama are also commonly worn by both female college students and female teachers or professors at graduation ceremonies because during the late 19th and early 20th centuries they were the standard female school uniform until the introduction of the [[serafuku]]. Also during this time period they were a fashionable day to day outfit for young women, often paired with a kimono with a simple geometric or floral print. Women's hakama tend to be either solid color or with a graduated hue, and hakama meant for young women may be sparsely decorated with floral decorations, they are paired with a solid color kimono.

h4. Examples

* !post #2982627: [[hakama pants]]
* !post #7662672: [[hakama shorts]]
* !post #6238172: [[long skirt|Long]] [[hakama skirt]]
* !post #2782322: [[hakama short skirt]]

h4. See also

* [[Kannushi]]
* [[Miko]]
* [[Samurai]]
* [[Qixiong Ruqun]]
* [[Japanese Clothes]]

title: death_momoi_(meme)
body:
A [[Blue Archive]] [[meme]] involving a very angry [[momoi (blue archive)|Saiba Momoi]], [[dual wielding]] [[knife|knives]] and threatening murder. She is occasionally depicted shouting "FATALITY...", "あなたたちのせいだよーーっ！！" [tn]It's all your guys' fault!![/tn] or "あなたたちを殺すよーーっ！！" [tn]I'm gonna kill all of you guys!![/tn].

Originally conceived in a "tweet":[https://twitter.com/capten_BM/status/1684186675042459656] by the artist [[Chikakei (tsuki no chika keikoku)|]], Chikakei later drew a depiction of "Death Momoi":[https://www.pixiv.net/en/artworks/111049175], spawning the meme.

One depiction of Death Momoi involves detached Momoi's head with hands holding knives arranged like a grinder wheel, which got associated to [[Helianthus (Armored Core VI)|Helianthus]] from [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]].

body:

It is basically a [[Core Fighter]] attached to a space booster unit that greatly increases itrs speed and range. It was piloted by [[Sleggar Law]] and [[Sayla Mass]].

title: may_(pokemon)
body:
[b]May[/b], known as [b]Haruka[/b] in Japan, is the female player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rse|Ruby, Sapphire,]] and [[Pokemon Emerald|Emerald]][/i].

May is a cheerful girl and the daughter of Professor Birch from the Hoenn region. She's great at taking care of others and loves cute Pokémon and conducting fieldwork [tn](official bio)[/tn].

In her [[pokemon oras|ORAS]] outfit, she has [[grey eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]]. She wears an [[orange hairband|orange]] [[bow hairband|hairband]], a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[orange shirt|shirt]], a [[bracelet]], [[bike shorts]] [[bike shorts under shorts|under]] [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts|shorts]], [[yellow shoes|yellow]] [[shoes]], and a [[green bag|green]] [[fanny pack|belt bag]].

Her [[Pokemon Adventures|Pokémon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Sapphire[/b] who has [[fangs]], [[sharp fingernails]] and sports on occasion a [[leaf bikini]] and [[grass skirt]], but mostly during fieldwork.

h4. Official Art

* !post #1763543: [[pokemon oras|ORAS]] (Contest)

title: jasmine_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Jasmine[/b], known as [b]Mikan[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon gsc|Gold and Silver]][/i].

This Gym Leader is known to have a heart that cares for Pokémon. While she appears calm and gentle, she can get quite fired up when talking about Steel-type Pokémon. Her signature Pokémon is [[Steelix]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[light brown hair]]. She wears [[hair bobbles]], a [[sundress]], and [[sandals]].

title: kamen_rider_agito_(shining_form)
body:
[[Kamen Rider Agito]]'s final form and an evolution of his [[kamen rider agito (burning form)|Burning Form]]. It is accessible if he is exposed to the [[sunlight]].

Though it has lower punching power compared to the Burning Form (probably due to the Burning Form's armor being shed during the transformation into this form), the rest of Agito's parameters are higher in comparison. Thus, Shining Form is Agito's most potent form overall.

This form also allows the usage of the [[Shining Caliber]], but Agito separates it into a pair of swords (called the Twin Mode) and uses them via [[dual wielding]].

His finishers while in this form are the:

* [i]Shining Clash[/i] - Delivers multiple slashes using the Shining Caliber in Twin Mode.
* [i]Shining Rider Kick[/i] - Stronger version of his [[Kamen Rider Agito (Ground Form)|Ground Form]]'s [[Rider Kick]].

title: vastaya
body:
The Vastaya are a race in [[League of Legends]].  They are chimeric creatures of Runeterra whose lineage contains both human blood and the spiritual magic of a pre-human race. From the ferocious, bestial power of [[Rengar]] to the foxlike allure of [[Ahri (league of legends)|]], vastaya can look considerably different from one another, but they all share animal and human characteristics.

title: clock_tower_3
body: [b][i]Clock Tower 3[/i][/b] is a [[PlayStation 2]] survival horror game and the fourth installment in the [i][[Clock Tower (series)|]][/i] series. It was developed by Capcom Production Studio 3 and Sunsoft, and published by Capcom on December 12, 2002 in Japan, on March 18, 2003 in North America and on June 25, 2003 in Europe.

title: clock_tower_2
body: [b][i]Clock Tower[/i][/b], known as [i]Clock Tower 2 (クロックタワー2)[/i] or [i]Clock Tower Second (クロックタワーセカンド)[/i] in Japan, is a [[PlayStation 1]] point-and-click survival horror game and a sequel to [[Clock Tower The First Fear|Clock Tower: The First Fear]].

title: clock_tower_the_first_fear
body: [b][i]Clock Tower: The First Fear (クロックタワー 〜ザ・ファーストフィアー〜)[/i][/b], originally known as [i]Clock Tower (クロックタワー)[/i], is a point and click survival horror game and the first installment in the [i][[Clock Tower (series)|]][/i] series. It was developed and published by Human Entertainment for the [[Super Famicom]] in Japan, on September 14, 1995, and then ported to the PC on March 28, 1997. It was released on the Japanese Virtual Console for both [[Wii]] on August 3, 2010 (Japan) and [[Wii U]] on November 6, 2013.

title: clock_tower_ghost_head
body: [b][i]Clock Tower II: The Struggle Within[/i][/b], known as [i]Clock Tower: Ghost Head (クロックタワーゴーストヘッド)[/i] in Japan, is a [[PlayStation 1]] point-and-click survival horror game and the third installment in the [i][[Clock Tower (series)|]][/i] series. It was developed and published by Human Entertainment on March 12, 1998 in Japan and later published by Agetec on October 31, 1999 in North America. It was released as a PlayStation Classic on the Japanese PlayStation Network for [[PlayStation 3]] on May 9, 2012.
other_names: クロックタワーゴーストヘッド

title: frogmouth
body:
JP: ガマグチヨタカ科 [i]gamaguchiyotakaka[/i] (squirrel hawk / tawny frogmouth)

A group of nocturnal birds in the Podargidae family, related to the nightjars. They are named for their large flattened hooked bill and huge frog-like gape, which they use to capture insects. There are about 14 species.

In 2019, Australian readers of The Guardian online voted the tawny frogmouth as the second most popular bird in the Australian Bird of the Year poll.

h4. See also
* [[Potoo]], a related kind of bird
* [[Tag Group:Birds]]

title: dracule_mihawk
body:
[[One Piece]] character. First introduced as one of the [[Shichibukai]] and later become the de-facto co-leader of Cross Guild along with [[Crocodile (one piece)|]].

He is known as the greatest swordsman in the world for his immense mastery of swordsmanship and [[Haki (one piece)|]]. As such, he served as the final obstacle for [[Roronoa Zoro]] of the [[Straw Hat Pirates]] for the title.

After effortlessly defeated Zoro during their first encounter, Mihawk became impressed by Zoro's tenacity and spares him so that he could become stronger. Later on, during the timeskip, Mihawk hosted Zoro along with [[Perona]] on his home island, and would later train him in various techniques, including the usage of Haki.

h4. See also
* [[S-Hawk]]
other_names: ジュラキュール・ミホーク

title: midoushima_yuu
body: Alyssa Hale (御堂島 優 Midōshima Yū, Yū Midōshima), born as Lynn Maxwell (才堂 凛 Saidō Rin, Rin Saidō), is the protagonist of [[clock tower ghost head| Clock Tower II: The Struggle Within]]. title: shou_(clock_tower)

title: scissorman
body: "Scissorman" (シザーマン Shizāman) refers to the identities of many antagonists of the Clock Tower series. There are multiple Scissormen and even Scissorwomen in the series.

title: scissorwoman
body: Scissorwoman (シザーウーマン Shizāūman), better known as Jemima (ジャニス Janisu, "Janis/Janice" in the Japanese version), is the sister of [[Scissorman]] Ralph and shares the same Entity as him. She is the first female Scissorman in the Clock Tower series, She is one of two tertiary antagonists and is a stalker in [[Clock Tower 3]]. Like her brother, she is a violent and psychopathic serial killer.

title: awp_(girls'_frontline)_(nekoya_(liu))
body:
A [[Girls' Frontline]] original character created by [[nekoya (liu)]], representing the English [[AI Arctic Warfare]] Police, or AWP for short.

AWP is seen wearing all white clothing with [[pale skin]], [[white hair]], [[blue eyes|light blue eyes]], [[cat ears]] and [[cat tail|tail]]. 

The AWP she uses is modified cosmetically; where the real life version is usually cased in a green, dark earth or black housing, this AWP sits in a white housing. She also carries a black [[Sig P220/P226|Sig P220]] sidearm.

title: smile_dog
body: "Smile.jpg", also known as "Smile.dog", is a [[creepypasta]] story about a haunted image that drives those who view it insane. The tale is often accompanied by a photoshopped picture of a sinister-looking Siberian Husky dog.

title: isekai_mokushiroku_mynoghra
body:
An isekai web novel written by Kazuno Fefu (鹿角フェフ "X Account":[https://x.com/fehu_apkgm]) and illustrated by [[Jun (Navigavi)|]] in the light novel adaption. There's also a manga adaption drawn by [[Midorihana Yasaiko]], as well as an anime adaption airing in summer 2025.

The series is set in a world that resembles a fantasy turn-based strategy (TBS) game. [[ira takuto|The protagonist]] reincarnated in an unknown world as the commander of the evil civilization Mynoghra, the weakest civilization from Eternal Nations, his favorite TBS game. With Mynoghra's hero unit [[Atou (isekai Mokushiroku Mynoghra)|]] by his side, the two resolve to create a new nation in this world.

[spoiler]It's later revealed that Eternal Nation's rules aren't the only ones that apply to the world. Players and NPCs from many other different games have also been reincarnated and all of their systems work simultaneously, colliding with each other when they meet.[/spoiler]

h4.External links
* "Anime official website (JP)":[https://mynoghra-anime.com/]
* "Official X (JP)":[https://x.com/myap_gcofficial]
* "Web novel (JP)":[https://ncode.syosetu.com/n8760ei/]
* "Wikipedia (EN): [i]Apocalypse Bringer Mynoghra[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apocalypse_Bringer_Mynoghra]

title: kamui_(pgr)
body:
A playable character in [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

Member of Strike Hawk, a task force that leads the charge in defeating corrupted enemies with the end goal of reclaiming Earth for humanity. Outgoing and happy-go-lucky, Kamui brings the jokes (and occasional stress) to his team. Originally shared his construct body with [[Camu (PGR)|]], a [[dark persona]], before later being revealed that Kamui was a cast-off persona born out of [[Camu (PGR)|]]'s wish during construct surgery to seal his hateful and angry persona.

title: hanamiya_rica
body:
An [[indie Virtual YouTuber]]. Originally did activities as an [[utaite]] named "Rica", she made her formal [[virtual YouTuber]] debut as "Hanamiya Rica" on October 31, 2024. Current character design by [[Kithera]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her outfit consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[beret]] with [[fake horns]], black [[hair ribbon]], [[sleeveless]] [[frilled shirt|frilled]] [[white shirt]] top, [[underbust]] [[black corset]], [[black jacket]] worn [[off shoulder]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[heart o-ring|heart-themed]] black [[thigh strap]] on her left leg, [[single thighhigh|single]] [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet thighhigh]] and a [[leg tattoo]] on her right leg, and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]].

Any posts referencing this character should generally be tagged with [[spoilers]].[/spoilers]

title: kamen_rider_agito_(storm_form)
body:
This is one of the forms of [[Kamen Rider Agito]].
He is characterized by a blue discoloration of his chest armor, left arm, and the center of the buckle of the [[Altering (agito)|]].
He has less physical strength and defense than his [[Kamen Rider Agito (Ground Form)|Ground Form]] , but has enhanced running and jumping ability.
His weapon is the [b][[Storm Halberd]][/b], a [[naginata]] with foldable [[double-sided_polearm|blades at both ends]].
His special move is the [b]Halberd Spin[/b], in which he creates a gust of wind by swinging his Storm Halberd and then slashes the enemy.

title: guro
body:
Guro is a Japanese term derived from the English word "grotesque". It is a genre of art dealing with themes of gore, mutilation, disfigurement, extreme violence or something that's just weird beyond comprehension (though the last one is considered an archaic definition).

Guro does not simply refer to violent or bloody imagery, but in fact [b]extreme graphic violence[/b]. Do not use this tag for images where the [[blood]] tag would suffice.

[[Body horror]] or the general presence of [[organs]] should not be considered guro unless extreme violence is involved.

An example that will be considered guro:
* post #4728418

Examples that should NOT be considered guro:
* post #5146599
* post #5247315

h4. See also

* [[horror (theme)]]
* [[ryona]]
* [[candy gore]]
* [[ero guro]]
* [[help:blacklists]]
* [[howto:rate]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ero guro":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ero_guro

title: super_earth_defense_force
body:
Earth Defense Force is a horizontally scrolling shooter developed by Jaleco and published as an arcade video game in 1991.[3] It was ported to the Super Nintendo Entertainment System as Super Earth Defense Force, dropping the two-player cooperative gaming mode while adding graphics and selectable weapons.[4] The Super NES version was released in Japan on October 25, 1991, and in North America in January 1992. The Super NES version was eventually released on the Wii Virtual Console in Europe on October 29, 2010, and in 2011 for Japan on January 11, and North America on July 14. It is included in Nintendo Switch SNES Online as of September 2019. It has no relation to the [[Earth Defense Force]] series of games. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earth_Defense_Force_(video_game)

title: microwave
body:
Also called a microwave oven, it is a kitchen appliance that uses dielectric heating to warm up food.

Not to be confused with a [[toaster oven]], a small countertop oven of similar shape.  Generally identifiable by the handle at the top of the door instead of to the side of the door with microwaves.

title: gabriel_(pgr)
body:
Non-playable character and boss encounter in [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

Formerly a member of [[Luna (PGR)|]]'s faction of Ascendants until his betrayal and then assassination by [[Alpha (PGR)|]], Gabriel was originally a corrupted [[robot|pure machine]] that was able to connect to the Ascension Network. He offered cult-like devotion to the advancement of the Ascension Network's goals in exchange for his ascension. His research eventually led to the creation of the Red Tide, a pseudobiological adaptation of the Punishing Virus capable of mocking human life.

title: crossed_fingers
body:
A hand gesture in which the index and middle fingers on one hand are crossed, like this: 🤞.

Crossing one's fingers is used to wish for good luck. Alternatively, when the gesture is hidden behind the back, it indicates telling a white lie or breaking a promise.

h4. Examples

* !post #6618590
* !post #2631328
* !post #4750937: Behind own back

h4. Not to be confused with

* [[X fingers]] - the index fingers of both hands are crossed to from an X
* [[interlocked fingers]] - the fingers of both hands are interlaced
* [[finger heart]] - the index finger crosses the thumb in a v pattern, forming a heart-like shape where the two fingers meet

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Gestures]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Crossed fingers":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crossed_fingers

title: duran_duran
body:
Duran Duran (/djʊˌræn djʊˈræn/) are an English pop rock band formed in Birmingham in 1978 by singer Stephen Duffy, keyboardist Nick Rhodes and guitarist/bassist John Taylor. After several early changes, the band's line-up settled in May 1980 as Rhodes, Taylor, singer Simon Le Bon, guitarist Andy Taylor and drummer Roger Taylor.


h4. Albums

*  [[Future Past (duran duran)|]] (2021), most famous for the song Invisible.

title: koikatsu_sunshine
body: Koikatsu Sunshine (コイカツ！サンシャイン in Japanese) is an eroge game created by the Japanese company Illusion and the successor to [[Koikatsu]]. The game was released on August 27, 2021. The story mode of the game revolves in the player (a male) going into vacation in a paradisiac southern Japanese island with his colleagues from an all-girl’s school with the objective to develop relationships with the girls. Koikatsu Sunshine also includes a character maker for create custom female and male characters. The game features an DLC with a studio mode for making scenes, positioning your character, or just taking screenshots of them. It also features a free DLC with Virtual Reality mode. For character models and images made using Koikatsu, see [[Koikatsu (medium)]].
other_names: コイカツサンシャイン

title: kamen_rider_ryuki_survive
body:
[[Kamen Rider Ryuki]]'s ultimate form, achieved by using the Survive Rekka card (albeit other Survive [[advent card|card]]s will suffice). In this form, Ryuki's armor grows noticeably and receives gold trims, his [[Advent Deck]] becomes red, and he gains the [[Dragvisor Zwei]].

h4. List of Advent Cards he owns
* Advent: Summon [[Dragranzer]].
* Sword Vent: The [[bayonet]] called the [b]Drag Blade[/b] appears from DragVisor Zwei.
* Guard Vent: Draglanzer defends against enemy attacks with the [b]Fire Wall[/b] that appears from its tail.
* Shoot Vent: He activates his special move, [b]Meteor Bullet[/b]. Simultaneous attacks by a [[energy bullet]] shot from his DragVisor Zwei and a [[fireball]] [[breathing fire|spit out]] by Dragranzer.
* Strange Vent: When scanned with DragVisor Twei, it changes into a different type of card and is ejected.
** Trick Vent: He activates his special move [b]Shadow Illusion[/b], which makes multiple [[clone]]s appear.
** Steal Vent: Steal weapons and armor summoned by the enemy.
* Final Vent: He activates his special move, [b]Dragon Firestorm[/b]. He performs a [[wheelie]] on Dragranzer, which has transformed into its [[motorcycle]] form, and then runs over the target after blocking their escape route with fireballs that Dragranzer spits out.
other_names: 仮面ライダー龍騎サバイブ

title: kamen_rider_agito_(ground_form)
body:
[[Kamen Rider Agito]]'s base form.
This form specializes in unarmed combat.

His special move, the [b][[Rider Kick]][/b], is executed through the following steps:
1. His horns unfold like a fan.
2. As Agito prepares, the golden Agito Crest appears at his feet and is absorbed into his feet.
3. He performs a [[flying kick]] at his target.

title: ramming
body:
A means of attack that accelerates toward the target and crashes its own head or body into the target.
It can also be used in combination with the [[headbutt]] tag against a post that is crashing its head into the target.

h4. Similar Items
* [[Tackle]]: The character accelerates towards the target, but this is an action to embrace or push down the target.

title: gloom_(expression)
body:
When a character is visibly depressed because they are disappointed, often the result of this is from a situation that ended quite comical, at least from reader's point of view.

Besides the facial expression, other indications of comical gloom include dark straight lines, a [[dark aura]], or [[hitodama]] around the character.

If the character is depressed due to overwhelming sadness or genuine distress, use [[despair]] or [[traumatized]] instead.

h4. Examples
* !post #8871895
* !post #328618

h4. See also

* [[gaijin 4koma (meme)|]]
* [[shaded face]]
* [[turn pale]]

body:

Her prototype is [[Amami Haruka]] from [[Idolmaster 1|THE IDOLM@STER (Arcade game)]].
Voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]].

h4. Profiles
* Birthday: April 3
* Age: 16
* Height: 158 cm (5' 2")
* Weight: 45 kg (99lb 3oz)
* Three sizes: 83 cm (33") - 56 cm (22") - 80 cm (31")
* Likes: [[penguin]]s, [[corn dog]]s and pink
* Strong subjects: Japanese and Physical Education

title: sandman_(sbr)
body:
Sandman, [spoilers]real name Soundman[/spoilers], is a secondary antagonist featured in the seventh part of the [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]] series, [[Steel Ball Run]].

His Stand is [[In a Silent Way (stand)|]].

Sandman is a man of athletic build. He wears his [[two-tone hair]] in  [[twin braids]] crossing his face. He is sparsely clothed, with a few [[tattoo]]s around his body. On both side of his biceps is a [[tattoo]] of a slithering [[snake]] inside a circle, lined with triangles pointing inward, while on his right chest are three lines that resemble check marks. He wears a  [[pelvic curtain]].
 
Namesake is the  Metallica song "Enter the Sandman"

title: aventurine_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. A member of the [[Ten Stonehearts]] and formerly known as [b][[Kakavasha (Honkai: Star Rail)|]][/b], voiced by [[Kawanishi Kengo]] (JP) and [[Camden Sutkowski]] (EN). 

He has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[purple eyes]] with [[diamond-shaped pupils]]. His default outfit consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[green shirt]] with a [[spade (shape)|]]-shaped [[clothing cutout]], [[black vest]], [[black jacket|black]] [[fur-trimmed jacket]], [[black gloves]], golden [[wristwatch]], [[white pants]], and [[black shoes]]. 

h4. Costumes

* !post #7691387: Splash art
* !post #8768260: [[Aventurine (final victor) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Final Victor]]
* !post #7484063: [[aventurine_(star_rail_live_2024)_(honkai:_star_rail)|Star Rail Live 2024]]
* !post #7395386: [[Aventurine (anan) (Honkai: Star Rail)|AnAn]]
* !post #7368956: [[Aventurine (Bullseye) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Bullseye]]
* !post #7856110: [[Aventurine (Stoneheart's Oath Ring) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Stoneheart's Oath Ring]]
* !post #8474543: [[Aventurine (Jiaduobao) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Jiaduobao]]
* !post #8526747: [[Aventurine (Origami Bird) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Origami Bird]]
* !asset #24066783: [[Aventurine (Boss) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Boss]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
"Go ahead, use me as you wish, even stab me in the back when you see fit. Exploitation and treachery are simply tools of the trade. But remember, I don't make deals that don't pay off... So, I hope you don't disappoint me."

A senior manager in the IPC Strategic Investment Department and one of the Ten Stonehearts. His Cornerstone is "Aventurine of stratagems."
He possesses an air of frivolity and doesn't shy away from taking risks. His constant smile makes it difficult for people to discern his true feelings.

He won his current position by wagering against fate itself. He views life as a high-stakes, high-return investment, and he plays this particular gamble with masterful ease.
[/expand]

h4. See also

* [[Kakavasha (honkai: star rail)|]]

h4. External links

* "Honkai: Star Rail Wiki: Aventurine":https://honkai-star-rail.fandom.com/wiki/Aventurine
other_names: アベンチュリン(スターレイル)
