title: twice_(boku_no_hero_academia)
body:
Character from [[Boku No Hero Academia]]. He is a villain with a split personality whose outfit is a full body [[superhero costume]]-esque black and grey [[jumpsuit]]. Without his mask, he has [[blonde hair]], [[grey eyes]], and a [[scar on forehead|scar]] down the middle of his forehead. His civilian name is Bubaigawara Jin.

His quirk, Double, allows him to create identical [[clone]]s of himself and others; the clones are less durable than their cloner and dissolve into a brown liquid when killed.

title: nine_(sonic)
body:
A character from [[Netflix]] show [[Sonic Prime]].
Tails Nine (or "Nine" for short), this [[Tails (Sonic)|Tails]]' counterpart from New Yoke City who built himself seven addition [[mechanical tail|mechanical tails]] after being constantly bullied for his [[multiple tails|twin tails]]. 

Nine is more closed off then the we know but seems to be eager to be friends with [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]].

title: socket_wrench
body:
A [[wrench]] that use specifically shaped holes on their ends (usually a hexagon or square), called sockets, that allowed the wrench to turn many [[bolt (hardware)|]]s, [[nut (hardware)|]]s, and other fasteners of different sizes and shapes.
 
The sockets can be on separate metal pieces that can attached to the wrench, making it [[socket (tool)|interchangeable]] with other sockets, or are physically fixed to the wrench. The wrenches can either features a reversible [b]ratcheting mechanism[/b] or not, which allows the user to pivot the tool back and forth to turn its socket instead of removing and repositioning the wrench to do so, during its usage in enclosed space. hence the reason why some of them are referred as ratchets.

This tag also applies to any tools for the similar purpose (like a breaker bar), or any specific kinds of socket wrenches.

h4. See also

* [[Impact wrench]]
* [[Lug wrench]]
* [[Socket (tool)]]
* [[torque wrench]]


h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Socket Wrench":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Socket_wrench]

title: impact_wrench
body:
An [b]impact wrench[/b] is a gun-shaped [[power tool]] designed to tighten any fasteners to any machinery, as tight as they can be. An impact wrench can perform more efficiently than a [[socket wrench]] by being commonly powered either by compressed air or electricity.  It operates by rapidly rotating a mass to store energy and then suddenly delivering it to its output shaft. 

Impact wrenches are used in a wide variety of industries, such as automotive repair, heavy equipment maintenance, product assembly, and construction.  They're a standard equipment of race car pit crews, and allow them to rapidly switch out the car's tires in less than 20 seconds.

Impact wrenches are also called impactors, impact guns, air wrenches, or air guns.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Impact wrench":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impact_wrench]

title: agent_3_(splatoon)
body:
Protagonist of [i][[splatoon_1|Splatoon]][/i]'s Hero Mode.

They are recruited into the [[squidbeak splatoon|New Squidbeak Splatoon]] by [[Cap'n Cuttlefish]] to help retrieve the [[zapfish]] from the underground civilization of Octo Valley.

Due to Agent 3 being the player character, they can be depicted as either gender, though they are often drawn as a girl with [[green_hair|green]] [[tentacle hair]] thanks to promotional materials surrounding Hero Mode. Regardless, Agent 3 always wears a "hero suit" consisting of a [[high-visibility_vest|bright]] yellow safety vest and pointed [[headgear]].

By the time of [i][[Splatoon 3]][/i], they have succeeded Cuttlefish as the captain of the New Squidbeak Splatoon. In this game, they are now simply known as "Captain", while [[agent 3 (splatoon 3)|a new agent]] inherits their former "Agent 3" callsign. 

* For their Splatoon 3 appearance: See [i][[Captain 3 (Splatoon)]][/i]

body:

title: red_king_(ultra_series)
body:
A [[kaiju]] from the [[Ultra Series]], subtitled the “[b]Skull Monster[/b],” debuting in the original [[Ultraman (1st series)|]]. They are often monstrous and ferocious but dim-witted in nature, and they also have a strong sense of camaraderie among their own kind. Contrary to their name, their body color is rarely red (inspiring [[Ultraman: The Ultimate Hero]] to have an actual red Red King, with the original yellow being used for females). They've appeared in [[The ultraman (anime)|The☆Ultraman]], [[Ultraman 80 (series)|]], [[Ultraman Max (series)|]] (where they are subtitled the [b]Armored Monster[/b], and capable of shooting explosive rocks from their mouths like cannonballs), [[Ultraman Mebius (series)|]], and more.  

Red King also appears in the Kadokawa version of [[Ultra Kaijuu Gijinka Keikaku]], designed by [[Namaniku ATK]].

h4. Ultra Kaijuu Gijinka Keikaku

* !post #1690614

Named [b]Utagawa Benio[/b], she is the champion of the fighting show "Kaijuu Fight" and is respected by [[miclas|Ushimaru Miku]]. Voiced by [[Igarashi Hiromi]].

title: abigail_williams_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Abigail Williams (fate)|]] in her Third Ascension form from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. While her outfit is mostly the same from her [[abigail williams (second ascension) (fate)|Second Ascension]], her hair turns white, her skin becomes greyish, and a third eye opens in the keyhole-shaped hole on her forehead. Her teddy bear also changes its appearance, replacing its face with a void that has a purple spiral in the center.

If her skin, hair, and third eye reflect this Ascension design even if she isn't wearing the outfit, this tag can be used to reference the visual change (post #4246710, post #5098149).

Don't confuse this Ascension with her [[abigail williams (swimsuit foreigner) (first ascension) (fate)|Swimsuit Foreigner's First Ascension]], nor her [[abigail williams (tour outfit) (fate)|Heroic Spirit Tour Outfit]].

Artists will often mix and match elements of her different ascensions, such as her hairstyle, headwear, eye color, skin color, and [[keyhole]] presence. If elements from multiple ascensions are present, use the tag that corresponds to her costume.

h4. Appearance
* !post #8971804

title: abigail_williams_(second_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Abigail Williams (fate)|]] in her Second Ascension form from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. This form goes though a radical change from her default First Ascension, starting with the [[keyhole]] on her forehead, and her eyes changing from blue to red. Her normal black hat becomes a gigantic black [[witch hat]] with numerous black and orange bows plus some [[teddy bear|teddy bears]] decorating it. Her villager clothes are replaced with a series of [[black bow|black bows]] on strings that hang from more [[bow|bows]] around her neck. The strings barely manage to cover her breasts, and it's not certain if her in-game sprite has her wearing a [[black bra]] beneath them. The only lower body garment she wears is an extremely [[lowleg panties|low-cut]] pair of [[black panties]]. She wears black [[mary janes]], and a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]] on her right leg that is lined with orange bows. She gains a pair of large black [[key|keys]] as her new weapons in this form, and the white tendrils she used to attack previously are now sinister [[tentacles]] that pop out of portals made by her keys.

Abigail's [[abigail williams (third ascension) (fate)|Third Ascension]] adapts this basic design while adding more alien-like embellishments.

Artists will often mix and match elements of her different ascensions, such as her hairstyle, headwear, eye color, skin color, and [[keyhole]] presence. If elements from multiple ascensions are present, use the tag that corresponds to her costume.

h4. Appearance
* !post #8971791

title: abigail_williams_(first_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Abigail Williams (Fate)|]] in her first ascension from [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Artists will often mix and match elements of her different ascensions, such as her hairstyle, headwear, eye color, skin color, and [[keyhole]] presence. If elements from multiple ascensions are present, use the tag that corresponds to her costume.

title: biting_coin
body:
Refers to a character [[biting]] a [[coin]] or [[mouth hold|holding]] one between their teeth/lips. Often, but not always, depicted as a way to test the coin's authenticity, as softer metals like lead would leave a mark, while gold would not. This practice is largely a myth popularized by films and literature however, rather than a reliable method of detecting counterfeits.

h4.See also
* [[money in mouth]] 
* [[mouth hold]]

title: deviruchi
body: Small [[demon]]s from [[Ragnarok Online]]. Their cute appearance made them popular enough to become one of the mascots of the game, alongside the [[Poring]]. They appear in many in-game costume items, including the very popular [[deviruchi hat]].

title: cowboy_western
body:
As in, the Western film genre. These are depictions of the Wild West and its characters.

This tag is mostly used on pictures having the iconic [[cowboy hat]] and other appropriate leather clothing items (particularly [[boots]], [[chaps]], and [[vest]]s). If you can see guns in the picture, they are usually [[revolver]]s ([[Colt Single Action Army]] usually) or [[rifle]]s ([[Winchester model 1894]] usually). [[Native American]]-styled characters might also apply in tagging Western artworks.

For male characters, use [[cowboy]].

title: sakura_miko_(street)
body:
The 7th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Sakura Miko]]. Unlike her past [[Amagai Tarou]] designs, this costume was designed by [[Saekiyahiro]].

It consists of a [[straw hat]], a [[detached collar|detached]] [[wing collar]] with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress|white]] [[pleated dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[vertical-striped skirt|vertical-striped]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[miniskirt]] over it, [[white socks]] and [[black boots|black]] [[lace-up boots]]. She also has optional [[frilled gloves]] [[white gloves|white]] short [[bridal gauntlets]] and several combinations of accessories, including a [[black shrug|black]] [[frilled shrug]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[overskirt]] and a [[black dress|]] [[strapless dress]] layer, as well as a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] version of the base dress.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has her [[medium hair|medium-length hair]] tied into a [[half up braid]] with a small [[one side up]] on her left tied with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]] and a small [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow]] with [[cherry blossoms]] on the back of her head.

h4. Appearance

title: juushi_no_yoru
body:
A 2016 Japanese live action coming of age movie.  The movie is set in 1987 and follows middle school student Oyama Takashi and his friends who live in a rural village.  Life is monotonous there, dealing with bullies and his annoying parents.  One day he and his friends become excited by a rumor that the AV actress Kyoko will be coming to the local video store they frequently visit to sign autographs.

h4. External links

* "IMDb: 14 That Night":[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt5538068/plotsummary/?ref_=tt_ov_pl]

title: spanglish_text
body:
The image contains text written by conversationally combining both [[spanish_text|Spanish]] and [[english_text|English]].

Spanglish is a blend of the words and grammar of Spanish and English, and is chiefly used in the [[united_states|United States]] and in [[puerto_rico|Puerto Rico]].

title: m1903_springfield
body:
The [b]Springfield M1903[/b] (United States Rifle, Caliber .30-06, Model 1903) is an American [[bolt action]] [[rifle]] built on the Mauser turnbolt action, fed with an internal 5-[[ammunition|round]] [[magazine (weapon)|]].

It was used by the US [[military]], most notably during [[World War I]], [[World War II]], the [[Korean War]], and in the [[Vietnam War]] in a limited [[sniper rifle|sniper]] role. It is recognizable by its straight grip stock, Type C semi-pistol grip stock (M1903A1 variant), bent bolt handle, oblong stock indentation on some models, and an adjustable flip-up rear sight or aperture one (M1903A3).

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* [[Springfield (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: M1903 Springfield":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M1903_Springfield

title: afternoon_shine_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it enables [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] to catch bugs. It can be acquired by progressing the main story.

The outfit includes a gray or green [[sweater]] with [[long sleeves]] that end in [[frills]]. Worn over the sweater is a set of [[yellow overalls]] with frilled straps, [[pocket|pockets]], a [[flower brooch]], and a design of a [[bee_print|bee]] printed on the chest. For legwear it includes [[white_socks|white]] [[kneehighs|kneehigh socks]] trimmed with [[ribbon_legwear|ribbon]], and [[brown shoes]] with yellow laces. The outfit's hairstyle is [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied into [[twintails]] with [[parted bangs]] and a [[hair_flower|flower hair ornament]]. Accessories for the outfit include a [[yellow_hat|yellow]] [[sun_hat]] with a [[blue ribbon]] tied around it, which is worn on the back, and a [[butterfly net]] with the net actually shaped like a butterfly.

Has an alternate color evolution (Rain) with black overalls, a white and orange striped shirt, and dark green hair, which is inspired by [[Socko (Infinity Nikki)|Sockos]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25977238
* !asset #25977248: Afternoon Shine: Rain

title: horizontal_bar
body:
A catchall tag for equipment that has a single horizontal bar where a user can lift and suspend themselves for various athletic or [[gymnastics|gymnastic]] exercises.

What is covered by this tag:

* [b]Athletic pull-up or chin-up bars[/b], a piece of equipment that is common in outdoor playgrounds and exercise stations.  Constructed of a metal bar suspended by wooden or metal supports on either side.  May be a triple or multi-unit where several are side-by-side and share supports between bars.
** Currently is the only type of equipment actually being depicted by this tag.
* [b]Gymnastics horizontal or high bar[/b], a piece of equipment composed of a steel or metal bar suspended by a rigid structure and cables. It is used by male gymnasts in performing various swings, aerial releases, and dismounts.  Due to users strongly swinging their weight on the bar, cables are necessary to keep the unit firmly restrained.

h4.See Also

* [[Barre]]
* [[Jungle gym]]
* [[Monkey bars]]
* [[Playground]]
* "Wikipedia - Chin-up bar":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chin-up_bar]
* "Wikipedia - Horizontal bar":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horizontal_bar]

title: high_efficiency_video_coding
kamen_rider_ryuki
body:
Lead Rider of [[kamen_rider_ryuki_(series)|Kamen Rider Ryuki]], twelfth show of the Kamen Rider series and third of the Heisei generation, as well as the first Rider from the same generation to be given an American adaptation, [i]Dragon Knight[/i].

Rookie journalist [[Kido Shinji]] finds himself in the middle of the Rider War, a deathmatch between 13 Kamen Riders, upon making a contract with [[Dragreder]], a Mirror Monster (themselves responsible for mysterious deaths throughout the city), to transform into Ryuki, fighting both Mirror Monsters and other Riders, as well as uncovering the truth of the Rider War.

Ryuki has a red color scheme and is modeled after both the Chinese dragon and a knight. He also uses [[Advent Card]]s to enhance his combat capabilities. Finally, he can upgrade into the bulkier, more powerful Ryuki Survive Form.

h4. List of Advent Cards he owns
* Advent: Call Dragreder.
* Sword Vent: Summons [b]DragSaber[/b], the [[dao]] that resemble DragReder's tail.
* Strike Vent: Summons [b]DragClaw[/b], the gauntlet that resemble DragReder's head.
* Guard Vent: Summons up to two [b]DragShield[/b], the shields that resemble DragReder's belly and limbs. They can also be worn as shoulder armor.
* Final Vent: The special move, [b]Dragon Rider Kick[/b], is activated. He jumps high into the air, catches Dragreder's [[breathing fire|fire breath]] on his back, and swoops down while covered in flames, [[rider kick|kicking]] his target.

h4. See also
* [[Kamen Rider Ryuki (Blank Form)]]
* [[Kamen Rider Ryuki Survive]]

title: dragreder
body:

It looks like a red [[Eastern dragon]].
It can fly through the air and uses its [b]Drag Breath[/b], a [[breathing fire|flame exhaled from its mouth]], as a weapon.

title: izumi_kanagi
body:
A character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. Her [[Doppel (madoka magica)|]] form is Catacombe.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] with [[blunt ends]] and [[asymmetrical bangs]], along with [[grey eyes]].

In her daily life, she wears the [[Daitou Academy school uniform]] paired with [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]].

As a [[Magical Girl]], she wears a [[white headwear|white]] [[garrison cap]], an [[opaque monocle|opaque]] [[monocle]], a [[black scarf|black]] [[fur scarf|fur]] [[scarf]], a [[white cape|cape]] with [[epaulettes]] and a [[chain]], a [[short dress|short]] [[fur-trimmed_dress|fur-trimmed]] [[white dress|white]] [[dress]] with [[buttons]], [[long sleeves|long]] [[detached sleeves]] with [[fur-trimmed_sleeves|fur]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[thighhighs]] held up by [[garter straps]] [[thighhighs under boots|worn under]] [[uneven boots|uneven]] [[white boots|white]] [[thigh boots]] on [[high heel boots|heels]]. Her weapon is a [[riding crop]].

title: souchou
body:
[[Kson]]'s current [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] avatar character (as opposed to Kson [[kson (person)|herself]]). This new character debuted on October 16, 2021 with the design by [[yaman]] and Live2D rigging by [[Kanbutsu Himono (artist)|]].

Souchou has a [[delinquent]] aesthetic with a removable black and white [[coat]], a [[sarashi]] worn in the style of a [[tube top]], [[pants|white puffy pants]], [[white boots]], [[black gloves]], pink [[sword]], [[black-framed eyewear|black-rimmed]] [[glasses]], a [[mole under eye|mole under her left-eye]], and [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair]] tied up in a [[spiked hair|spiky]] [[high ponytail]], though she can wear it loose with an [[ahoge]] on top. She is [[tall female|189.3 cm tall]].

The Souchou tag refers to Kson wearing this specific attire; do [b]not[/b] tag every image of Kson as "Souchou" if she's not wearing this costume.

title: tiny_kong
body:
A member of the Kong Family introduced in [[Donkey Kong 64]], and has participated in one [[Mario (series)|]] spinoff game, [[Mario Super Sluggers]].

Her most significant traits is her [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[twintails]], as similar to [[Dixie Kong]] they are used to attack enemies and allow her to descend slowly to the ground like a helicopter. As her name "Tiny" suggests, she also has the ability to shrink in size when entering a Tiny Barrel.

Originally she was depicted with [[blue overalls]] that were [[print overalls|printed]] with a [[floral print|flower]] [[smiley face]] on them. Under the overalls were a [[white shirt]] and she wore [[white shoes]]. After the drastic redesign she received in [i]Diddy Kong Racing DS[/i] onward however her current depiction is vastly different. She is now much more humanoid in figure like [[Candy Kong]], given noticeable [[eyelashes]], and applies [[red eyeshadow]] and [[pink nails|pink]] [[nail polish]]. She now wears [[blue pants|blue]] [[sweatpants]], a [[blue camisole]] [[crop top]] with a similar flower smiley face and [[pink sandals]] along with [[hoop earrings]] and white [[fur wrist cuffs]]. Aside from the aforementioned blonde twintails, both iterations have [[blue eyes]] and a similar [[multicolored hat|multicolored]] [[beanie]].

She was initially Dixie Kong's younger sister but after the redesign it is unsure if this setting is still in consideration.

title: chloe_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Chloe[/b], known as [b]Koharu[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in the [i][[Pokemon Journeys|Pokémon Journeys]][/i] anime.

She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair]] worn in a [[braided ponytail]]. She wears a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[collared dress|collared]] [[white dress]] with a [[neck tassel]], [[grey socks]], [[white boots|white]] [[boots]], and a [[brown bag|brown]] [[backpack]] (post #4423023).

title: brendan_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Brendan[/b], known as [b]Yuuki[/b] (ユウキ) in Japan, is the male player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rse|Ruby and Sapphire]][/i].

His goal is to be like his dad, Norman—a Gym Leader he really looks up to. He is a bit mischievous, but he is serious about Pokémon battles [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

In his [[pokemon oras|ORAS]] outfit, he has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair|hair]]. He wears a [[white hat|white]] [[beanie|hat]], a [[tight shirt|tight]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeve]] [[turtleneck]] shirt with a [[zipper pull tab|zipper pull]], a [[bracelet]], [[black pants|black]] [[capri pants|pants]], [[white shoes|white]] and [[green shoes|green]] [[sneakers]], and a [[green bag|green]] [[backpack]].

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Ruby[/b] who has [[red eyes]], sometimes wears [[glasses]] and hides claw-shaped [[scar|scars]] on his forehead under his hat.

title: dao
body:
Hanji: 刀

Chinese single-edged [[sword|swords]].

The most common type is the "liuye-dao":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liuyedao] (柳叶刀/柳葉刀, literally ”willow leaf blade”). It is similar to a [[scimitar]]. In Japan it is often called 青竜刀/青龍刀 that was originally a Chinese abbreviation for [[Guan Yu]]'s [[qinglong_yanyue_dao|Green Dragon Crescent Blade]] (青龍偃月刀).

See also:

* [[Jian (weapon)]] - Chinese double-edged straight swords
* [[List of weapons]]
* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dao_%28sword%29

title: kido_shinji
body:
[b]Kido Shinji[/b] is the protagonist of [[Kamen Rider Ryuki (Series)|]] and the one who transforms into [[Kamen Rider Ryuki]].
He is the apprentice reporter working for ORE Journal, a mobile online news distribution company.
He is considered an idiot, for better or worse. However, he has a strong sense of justice, and not only tries to protect publics from Mirror Monsters, but also works hard to stop the conflict between the Kamen Riders.

Acted by [[Suga Takamasa]].

title: light_type_guncannon
body:
A [[mobile suit]] that appears in [[gundam gquuuuuux|Mobile Suit Gundam GQuuuuuux]].

[b]RGM-79 Light Type Guncannon[/b]

In an [[alternate universe]] where the [[White Gundam|RX-78-02 Gundam]] was stolen by [[Char Aznable]], the equivalent of the [[gm (mobile suit)|GM]] became based on the [[Guncannon]] instead of the White Gundam. Visually, it is a combination of the head and body of a Guncannon with the limbs of the RX-78-02.

title: t-72
body:
A family of [[Soviet]] second-generation main battle [[tank]]s of the second half of the [[Cold War]] that entered production in 1971. It was widely exported to numerous countries both in and outside of the "Warsaw Pact":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warsaw_Pact, and many are still in service to this day.

h4. See also

* [[List of ground vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: T-72":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T-72]

title: flag_zombie_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A regular [[zombie (plants vs. zombies)|]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series that [[holding flag|holds a]] [[flag]] emblazoned with brain picture, leading a huge wave of fellow [[zombie]]s.

title: melon-pult_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
A [[fruit]]ing [[plant]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series that hurls [[watermelon]]s capable of dealing heavy damage towards a group of zombies. Costs 300 suns.

h4. See also

* [[Winter Melon (plants vs. zombies)|]]

title: winter_melon_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: An upgrade [[plant]] for the [[Melon-pult (plants vs. zombies)|]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]]. It hurls blue cold [[watermelon]]s that slows down nearby group of zombies. Costs 200 suns.

title: ladder_zombie_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A [[zombie]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] which carries a [[ladder]] to be placed on a defensive plant ([[Wall-nut (plants vs. zombies)|]], [[Tall-nut (plants vs. zombies)|]] or [[Pumpkin (plants vs. zombies)|]]), so others can pass through.

title: pumpkin_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
The [[jack-o'-lantern|carved]] pumpkin from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series that can be planted on a plant as a protective shell. Costs 125 suns.

h4. See also

* [[Tall-nut (plants vs. zombies)|]]
* [[Wall-nut (plants vs. zombies)|]]

title: tall-nut_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: Essentially the tougher and taller variant of the [[Wall-nut (plants vs. zombies)|]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series. Therefore, zombies cannot jump over it. Costs 125 suns.

title: wall-nut_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
The [[walnut]] [[plant]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series. It serves as a defensive "wall" that blocks zombies in order to protect other plants. Costs 50 suns.

h4. See also

* [[Tall-nut (plants vs. zombies)|]]
* [[Pumpkin (plants vs. zombies)|]]

title: umbrella_leaf_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A broad-leaved [[plant]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] that protects nearest plants from [[Bungee Zombie (plants vs. zombies)|]]s and deflects projectiles hurled by the [[Catapult Zombie (plants vs. zombies)|]]s. Costs 100 suns.

title: fire_peashooter_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: Red fiery pea-based plant from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series. Besides firing peas that have been lit aflame like those affected by the [[Torchwood (plants vs. zombies)|]], it also thaws plants frozen by cold in a small radius around it. Costs 175 suns.

title: torchwood_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A [[plant]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] that resembles a [[tree stump]] on [[fire]]. A normal pea that passes through it turns into fireball with more damage. The Torchwood can also clear up a small amount of fog. Costs 175 suns.

title: peashooter_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
A hair dryer-shaped [[plant]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] that shoots peas. Costs 100 suns.

h4. See also

* [[Snow Pea (plants vs. zombies)|]]
* [[Repeater (plants vs. zombies)|]]
* [[Threepeater (plants vs. zombies)|]]
* [[Split Pea (plants vs zombies)|]] 
* [[Gatling Pea (plants vs. zombies)|]]
* [[Goo Peashooter (plants vs. zombies)|]]
* [[Electric Peashooter (plants vs. zombies)|]]
* [[Fire Peashooter (plants vs. zombies)|]]
* [[Shadow Peashooter (plants vs. zombies)|]]

title: threepeater_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A [[plant]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] that shoots peas on three lanes at once. Basically a three-headed [[Peashooter (plants vs. zombies)|]] that costs 325 suns.

title: sun-shroom_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A sun-producing [[mushroom]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series, which has a golden yellow cap and smiling face. Costs 25 suns.

title: solar_flare_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
[b]Solar Flare[/b] is a plant hero from [[Plants vs. Zombies Heroes]]. 

She was originally a [[Sunflower (plants vs. zombies)|]].

h4. See also

* [[Solar Flare (plants vs. zombies) (peargor)|]]

title: sunflower_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: The most essential [[flower]]ing [[plant]] in the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series, produces [[sunflower|suns]]. It costs 50 suns.

title: spikerock_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: An upgrade plant for the [[Spikeweed (plants vs. zombies)|]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]], taking appearance as of sharp grey rocks. It inflicts faster and more damage. Also capable of popping multiple vehicle tires and withstanding [[Gargantuar (plants vs. zombies)|]] attacks. Costs 125 suns.

title: spikeweed_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
A [[plant]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] that damages multiple zombies stepping on it. Can also be used as an instant use killer against vehicular enemies (e.g. Zomboni and [[Catapult Zombie (plants vs. zombies)|]]). Costs 100 suns.

h4. See also

* [[Spikerock (plants vs. zombies)|]]

title: peargor
body:
Artist.

h4. Original characters

* [[Butterscotch (peargor)|]]

title: solar_flare_(plants_vs._zombies)_(peargor)
body: A semi-[[original]] [[personification|personified]] version of [[Solar Flare (plants vs. zombies)|]] (a [[sunflower]]) from [[Plants vs. Zombies Heroes]] designed by artist [[Peargor]] and sometimes [[borrowed character|borrowed]] by others.

title: snow_pea_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: Ice blue-colored pea [[plant]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series. It shoots frozen peas that slows down zombies. Costs 175 suns.

title: shadow_peashooter_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: The shadow plant equivalent of the regular [[Peashooter (plants vs. zombies)|]]. Pulls zombies into the ground when they are close by it. When under the empowering effects of the [[Moonflower (plants vs. zombies)|]], its regular peas are replaced with zombie-piercing bolts. Costs 125 suns.

title: scaredy-shroom_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A purple-capped [[mushroom]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series that shoots like the [[Peashooter (plants vs. zombies)|]], but it will hide if a zombie is being too close. Costs 25 suns.

title: gatling_pea_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
An upgrade [[plant]] for the [[Repeater (plants vs. zombies)|]] in [[Plants vs. Zombies]]. It wears a [[combat helmet]] and has a [[Gatling gun]] in its mouth that shoots four peas at once. It returns in [[Plants vs. Zombies 2]], under the new name of "Mega Gatling Pea."

h4. Appearance
* !asset #26121166: [[Plants vs. Zombies]]
* !asset #26121169: [[Plants vs. Zombies 2]]
* !asset #26121174: [[Plants vs. Zombies 2 (Chinese)]]

title: repeater_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A [[plant]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series. Unlike [[Peashooter (plants vs. zombies)|]]s, it shoots two peas at once and has more leaves on the back of its head. Costs 200 suns.

title: puff-shroom_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: Small purple [[mushroom]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] that shoots spores at short range. Costs zero sun.

title: potato_mine_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A [[potato]] plant from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] that explodes on contact. It takes few moments to activate. Costs 25 suns.

title: pole_vaulting_zombie_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A [[zombie]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] that is dressed in [[sportswear]] and a [[blue headband]] and [[sportswear]]. It runs fast before [[jumping]] over a plant once with a [[pole vault|pole]] on hand.

title: plantern_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: An environment modifier [[plant]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series. Its prominent use is to light up an area of fog and to reveal the contents of nearby vases on Vasebreaker game mode. Costs 25 suns.

title: electric_peashooter_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: Light teal-green pea [[plant]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series. It shoots lightning orbs shaped like [[Peashooter (plants vs. zombies)|]] peas, which behave in a similar way to the Lightning Reed. Costs 200 suns.

title: green_shadow_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
A plant hero from [[Plants vs. Zombies Heroes]]. 

She was originally a [[Peashooter (plants vs. zombies)|]].

title: patrice_blazing_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
Patrice is the female protagonist of the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] comic book series.

h4. External links

* "Fandom - Plants vs Zombies Wiki - Patrice Blazing":[https://plantsvszombies.fandom.com/wiki/Patrice_Blazing]

body:
Nate is a male character in the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] comic book series.

h4. External links

* "Fandom - Plants vs Zombies Wiki - Nate Timely":[https://plantsvszombies.fandom.com/wiki/Nate_Timely]

title: kernel-pult_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
A [[corn]] [[plant]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series that hurls small kernels. However, it has a chance of hurling butter bars with more damage and capable of immobilizing zombies. Costs 100 suns.

h4. See also

* [[Cabbage-pult (plants vs. zombies)|]]
* [[Melon-pult (plants vs. zombies)|]]

title: cabbage-pult_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
A [[vegetable]] [[plant]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series that hurls [[cabbage]]s. Costs 100 suns.

h4. See also

* [[Kernel-pult (plants vs. zombies)|]]
* [[Melon-pult (plants vs. zombies)|]]

title: marigold_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A [[flower]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] with [[white flower|white]] petals that produces [[coin]]s. Costs 50 suns.

title: gold_magnet_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A normal [[plant]] upgrade for the [[Magnet-shroom (plants vs. zombies)|]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]]. It will only collect nearby coins for the player. Costs 50 coins.

title: magnet-shroom_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
A [[magnet]]ic [[mushroom]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series that steals metallic objects worn or carried by some zombies, stripping away their armor or special abilities. Costs 100 suns.

h4. See also

* [[Gold Magnet (plants vs. zombies)|]]

title: cattail_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A pink, [[cattail|cat-shaped]] aquatic [[plant]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] that shoots multiple homing spikes. It costs 225 suns and meant as an purchasable upgrade for the [[Lily Pad (plants vs. zombies)|]].

title: flower_pot_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
The [[flower pot]] is an environment modifier quasi-plant from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series that enables [[plant]]ing on roof tiles. Costs 25 suns.
It also appears on Zen Garden mode.

h4. See also

* [[Lily Pad (plants vs. zombies)|]]

title: lily_pad_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
The [[lily pad]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series enables planting non-aquatic plants on it. Costs 25 suns.

h4. See also

* [[Flower Pot (plants vs. zombies)|]]

title: cob_cannon_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A purchasable upgrade [[plant]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series that manually launches an [[explosive]] [[corn]] cob upon the targeted area. It costs 500 suns and must be planted on two horizontally-adjacent [[Kernel-pult (plants vs. zombies)|]]s.

title: jalapeno_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: The [[jalapeno pepper|Jalapeno]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series is an instant-use [[plant]] that burns all enemies on a lane. Costs 125 suns.

title: gargantuar_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
A [[giant|gigantic]], [[muscular]] [[zombie]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series with extremely high health. It crushes plants on sight.

An injured Gargantuar that is not immediately defeated will hurl an [[Imp (plants vs. zombies)|]] upon the third column of player's defense.

title: imp_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A fast, tiny [[zombie]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series that is commonly seen riding on [[Gargantuar (plants vs. zombies)|]]'s back.

title: imitater_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A purchasable [[potato]] plant from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] that can imitate any preselected [[plant]] in greyscale, allowing the player to have two same plants within a seed slot.

title: ice-shroom_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
A character in the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series. Despite being referred to as a "[[plant]]," it is actually an [[ice]]-covered [[mushroom]].

In its debut appearance, it is single-use, temporarily [[frozen|freezing]] every zombie on screen. In [[Plants vs. Zombies 2]], it is a melee attacker that slows zombies and provides boosts to nearby ice plants.

h4. External links
* "Plants vs. Zombies Wiki":[https://plantsvszombies.fandom.com/wiki/Ice-shroom]

title: hypno-shroom_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A [[mushroom]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]]. It has a colorful conical cap, white stem, and red swirly eyes. The zombie who ate it will fight on the player's side. Costs 75 suns.

title: grave_buster_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: An instant use [[plant]] in the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series that destroys a [[tombstone]], dropping a [[coin]] or sometimes a prize afterwards. Costs 75 suns or zero (on PVZ 2).

title: grass_knuckles_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
A plant hero from [[Plants vs. Zombies Heroes]]. 

He was originally a [[Bonk Choy (Plants vs. Zombies)|]] ([[bok choy]]).

title: garlic_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: The [[Garlic]] is a defensive plant from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series. Zombies that bite it will divert into another lane. Costs 50 suns.

title: fume-shroom_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A large purple [[mushroom]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]]. It shoots spore fumes that damage multiple zombies, ignoring their shield items such as doors or ladders. Costs 75 suns.

title: football_zombie_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A [[zombie]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]], which is dressed in [[American football uniform]]. Runs fast and has very high health point due to the [[American football helmet|helmet]].

title: dr._zomboss_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
The main antagonist of the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series, serving as the final boss of the first game and a recurring boss in the [[plants vs. zombies 2|sequel]]. He is a [[mad scientist]] [[zombie]], and is typically seen piloting a [[mecha]] called a "Zombot."

h4. External links
* "Plants vs. Zombies Wiki":[https://plantsvszombies.fandom.com/wiki/Dr._Zomboss]

title: doom-shroom_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A [[mushroom]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] with black cap, grey stem and red eyes. It [[explosion|explodes]] into a [[mushroom cloud]], leaving an unplantable [[crater]]. Costs 125 suns.

title: dancing_zombie_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
A [[zombie]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] that dances under the spotlight and summon four backup dancers.

The original model sparked a controversy for resembling the late [[Michael Jackson]], due to his outfit and hairstyle as seen on the [[Thriller (michael jackson)|]] music video.

title: crazy_dave_(plants_vs._zombies)
body:
David Blazing III, or commonly known as [b]Crazy Dave[/b] is a non-playable character from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] who serves a gibberish narrator. He also owns a shop on the back of his car.

Dave has [[brown hair|brown]] [[short hair]], thick [[beard]], and wears a [[saucepan]] [[object on head|on head]].

title: coffee_bean_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: The [[coffee beans|Coffee Bean]] is an instant-use plant from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series that wakes up a sleeping [[mushroom]] during the day. Costs 75 suns.

title: chomper_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: Purple carnivorous [[plant]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] that resembles a large [[Venus flytrap]]. It devours the nearest zombie. Costs 150 suns.

title: cherry_bomb_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: The [[Cherry|Cherry Bomb]] is an instant-use [[plant]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series that [[explosion|explodes]] in a 3×3 area. Costs 150 suns.

title: catapult_zombie_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A [[zombie]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] that operates a [[motor vehicle|vehicle]] carrying [[basketball (object)|]]s. It will hurl the balls at a targeted plant on the farthest side of the lane. Once running out of basketballs, the zombie will run over and crush any plant on its way.

title: cactus_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: The [[cactus]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series shoots spikes that can pop balloons. Costs 125 suns.

title: bungee_zombie_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A [[Plants vs. Zombies]] character. Bungee [[zombie]]s will descend to the ground marked with an arrow and target in order to steal a plant.

title: buckethead_zombie_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A regular [[zombie]] from the [[Plants vs. Zombies]] series that wears a metal [[bucket]] [[object on head|on head]], granting it high health point.

title: blover_(plants_vs._zombies)
body: A fan-like [[plant]] from [[Plants vs. Zombies]] that blows away all Balloon Zombies on sight and causing the fog to temporarily disappear. Costs 100 suns.

title: buhanochka_z
body: [[derivative work|Traces]] other people's works.

title: zudah
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse, first appearing in [[Gundam MS IGLOO]].

[b]EMS-10 Zudah[/b]

An early experimental [[Zeon]] combat [[mobile suit|MS]] rival of the [[Zaku I]] developed by the Zimmad Company. It was fast, had a versatile array of weapons which included a 135mm anti-ship rifle and was perceived as vastly outperforming the Zaku I - except it was all propaganda: the suit was prone to overloading its engine and exploding at random, and it did so in multiple occasions despite endless attempts at fixing such horrible behavior, being deemed a total and utter failure.

However this problem was eventually solved and the Zudah was actually modernized and used in battle some time later by selected Zeon and [[Neo Zeon]] units in a limited capacity.

In [[Gundam GQuuuuuuX]]'s final episode, [spoiler]one of the alternate timelines witnessed by [[Lalah Sune|Lalah]] depicted [[Char Aznable|Char]] piloting a red Zudah. Due to the suit's aforementioned issues, viewers quickly joked that his death in that timeline had nothing to do with the Earth Federation Forces and all to do with him being set up to die from suit failure.[/spoiler]

Would be named [i]Elegant[/i] in the [i][[Azur Lane]][/i] collab on late Spring 2019, and be worn by Azur Lane's Saratoga in her skin '[[Saratoga (Virtual Idol) (Azur Lane)|Virtual Idol]]'. h4. Appearance

* !post #3463528: Profile
other_names: キズナアイ・エレガント

title: kizuna_ai_inc.
body:
[b]Kizuna AI Inc.[/b] (KizunaAI株式会社, Kizuna Ai Co., Ltd.) is an autonomous subsidiary of Tokyo-based digital production company Activ8, producers of [[Kizuna AI]] from the start, oriented around her and related talent. 

Kizuna's main YouTube channel, named A.I. Channel, debuted November 29, 2016. Following this, a second channel, named A.I.Games, debuted in March 2017 as to concentrate on gaming-related content, together with a unique design for the channel. Kizuna would also spearhead activ8's [[project upd8]], with folks joining squarely because of her even.

Starting from May 2019, as part of her 'Kizuna AI's Everyday' series, the "Multiple AI Project":[https://krazete.github.io/ailog/static] was introduced, to expand the AIs on the main channel. Of the ones who appeared, two would remain. By December 2019, these two other AIs would receive hairclips and nicknames, as to distinguish them from the main AI, being henceforth known as [[love=charmulet]] and [[AI-pii (kizuna ai)|]].  In late June 2019, a fourth AI debuted, aimed for Chinese audiences, with a unique design and a new channel, named A.I. Channel China. She too would receive a nickname by December, becoming known as [[AI-ge (Kizuna AI)|]].

On April 20, 2020, in a press release, activ8 announced that they would spinning off Kizuna Ai into her own subsidiary, where she would be joined by her fellow AIs, active from May 11. Later, on May 8, it was announced that love-chan and AI-pii would be spinning off into their own channel, debuting on the 13th.

h4. Talent

* [[Kizuna AI]]
** [[Black AI]]
* [[love=charmulet]] (graduated) and [[AI-pii (kizuna ai)|]] (retired) // [[love-pii channel]]
* [[AI-ge (Kizuna AI)|]] // A.I. Channel China
* [[Kizuna no Allele]] // Alleles Project (concluded)
* [[ENGI-MONOGATARI]] (on hiatus)

h4. Related tags

* [[Kizuna AI (Cosplay)]]
* [[Install!]]

title: len'en
body:
Len'en (鏈縁 or 連縁, lit. "Connecting Chain") is a series of vertical [[danmaku]] shooting games made by [[jynx (trick nostalgie)|JynX]], set in the land of Mugenri. Although inspired by [[Touhou]] and [[Seihou]], the games are not Touhou fangames. They are set in a separate world featuring an entirely new cast of characters.

Also of note is that while in Touhou the characters are all female, in Len'en [[androgynous|the characters' genders are generally left ambiguous.]] It is likely that their genders will never be revealed, and that it will simply be up to the player's interpretation. Most of the characters have names that reference [[bird]]s.

h4. Games

* 鏈縁 无現里 (Len'en Mugenri) ～ [[Evanescent Existence]] 
* 鏈縁 蛇叢釼 (Len'en Tasouken) ～ [[Earthen Miraculous Sword]] 
* 鏈縁霊烈傳 (Len'en Reiretsuden) ～ [[Reactivate Majestical Imperial]] 
* 連縁天影戦記 (Len'en Teneisenki) ～ [[Brilliant Pagoda or Haze Castle]]
* 連縁カフェ (Len'en Cafe) ～ [[BOOK of the CAFE]]

h4. Characters

h6. Evanescent Existence

* [[Houlen Yabusame]]
* [[Enraku Tsubakura]]
* [[Kurohebi]]
* [[Shitodo Aoji]]
* [[Shitodo Hooaka]]
* [[Shitodo Kuroji]]
* [[Clause (len'en)|]]
* [[Senri Tsurubami]]

h6. Earthen Miraculous Sword

* [[Amanomiya Jun]]
* [[Amanomori Shou]]
* [[Celeritas Lumen]]
* [[Kokutenshi Hibaru]]
* [[Katano Sukune]]
* [[Adagumo no Yaorochi]]
* [[Tasouken]]
* [[Adagumo no Saragimaru]]

h6. Reactivate Majestical Imperial

* [[Kitsugai Sese]]
* [[Umatachi Tsugumi]]
* [[Fujiwara no Iyozane]]
* [[Taira no Fumikado]]

title: ai-pii_(kizuna_ai)
body:
The third AI to join Kizuna AI, as part of the Multiple AI Project, starting from May 2019.

Initially referred to as AI #3 (and unofficially nicknamed 好きぴ (Sukipi)), to differentiate the differently-voiced AI from the original, when not wearing the default attire, she'd wear the [[kizuna_ai_(a.i._games)|A.I.Games]] outfit to further distinguish herself. By December, as to make it easier to distinguish them, she received a * hairclip and became known as "AI-pii":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WQ-MErCNOMQ].

In May 2020, it was announced that she would be receiving her own Twitter account, and that she'd be joining [[love=charmulet]] in a new shared YouTube channel, called the [[love-pii channel]]. On June 13th, she finally received a unique design.

Following the release of the love-pii song Uinatsu on September 13th, AI-pii ceased her activities at Kizuna AI Inc. "effective":[https://twitter.com/KizunaAIinc/status/1306128297261068288] from September 16th.

h4. External links

* Youtube Channel: "love-pii channel":[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYm8zALd2uHqyy6C1tb4_zA] | "Debut":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I17_ia2vqX0]
* Twitter: "@aipii_lp":[https://twitter.com/aipii_lp]

title: love=charmulet
body:
The second AI to join Kizuna AI, as part of the Multiple AI Project, starting from May 2019.

Initially referred to as AI #2 (and unofficially nicknamed キュール (Kyu-ru)), to differentiate the differently-voiced AI from the original, when not wearing the default attire, she'd wear the [[kizuna ai (elegant)|Elegant]] outfit to further distinguish herself. By December, as to make it easier to distinguish them, she received a # hairclip and became known as "love-chan":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sp0n12L3Fo0].

In May 2020, it was announced that she would be receiving her own Twitter account, and that she'd be joining [[AI-pii (kizuna ai)|]] in a new shared YouTube channel, called the [[love-pii channel]]. On June 13th, she finally received a unique design. From September 25th onward, she became the solo host of the channel, renamed "love channel". After Ai-chan went on hiatus in February 2022, Love-chan became one of the main representatives of the brand, which remained the case until May 2024, when she graduated from [[Kizuna AI Inc.]] and became an indie under the name "love=charmulet".

h4. External links

* Youtube Channel: "love=charmulet":[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYm8zALd2uHqyy6C1tb4_zA] | "Debut":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KuJIyXK9yYw]
* Twitter: "@love=charmulet":[https://twitter.com/i/user/1258664290581504001]
other_names: らぶちゃーみゅれっと

title: ai-ge_(kizuna_ai)
body:
Chinese-installed [[Kizuna AI]], introduced during Kizuna's birthday event on June 30th, 2019. The fourth AI introduced as part of the Multiple AI Project, starting from May 2019, she also has a different voice actress, but, unlike the other two, had her own design from the start.

She represents A.I.Channel on bilibili, but also manages the spin-off YouTube channel "A.I.Channel China". She is handled by different producers in collaboration with [[Kizuna AI Inc.]] and their license.

On December 4th, 2019, alongside her fellow AIs, she asked viewers for an official nickname. She would later announce the nickname on December 19th, "revealing":[https://youtu.be/pNzTV9Wc8c4] it to be "AI-ge" (爱哥) (= AI-bro or AI-aniki).

h4. External links

* Youtube Channel: "A.I.Channel China":[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCArUdy5xj0i0cTuhPHRVMpw] | "Debut":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SXq7JMfpPuU]
* Bilibili Spaces: "AIChannel中国绊爱":[https://space.bilibili.com/484322035] | "哎咿多工作室":[https://space.bilibili.com/11673035]
* Twitter: "@KizunaAIChina":[https://twitter.com/KizunaAIChina]

title: finger_heart
body:
A popular hand gesture among [[k-pop]] idols used as a more subtle substitute for [[heart hands]]. The index finger typically crosses the thumb in a v pattern, forming a heart-like shape where the two fingers meet. Only one hand is used for this gesture; if two hands are used then it is likely [[heart hands]] instead.

title: night_angel_(last_origin)
body:
Character from [[Last Origin]].

The lieutenant to [[May of Doom]] for the Doom Bringers, B-11 Night Angel gained popularity for being one of the very few (if not the only) [[flat chest]]ed characters in a game infamous for [[huge breasts]] being a norm.

By default, Night Angel has long [[red hair]] with a B-2 shaped hairclip to the right, a black dress, and knee high armored boots.

title: mark_(fire_emblem:_the_blazing_blade)
body:
Mark is portrayed as a mysterious traveler who is found unconscious on the plains by [[Lyn (fire emblem)|]] at the beginning of [[Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade]]. They are the first custom character to appear in the Fire Emblem series.

Mark was introduced to give the player an actual role in the game and help introduce players to [[Fire Emblem]] gameplay. This is particularly notable given that The Blazing Blade was the first Fire Emblem to be released internationally.

h4. Appearances
* !post #6203462: [[Mark (winds of hope) (fire emblem: the blazing blade)|Winds of Hope]] (with [[lyn (fire emblem)|Lyn]])

title: astrid_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Astrid[/b] (ステラ [i]sutera[/i]; Stella) is a playable character from [[Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance]] and [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]].

She is a member of the Crimean Royal Knights, and a former member of Begnion's noble House Damiel. Astrid was engaged to Duke [[Lekain]] of Gaddos, a sinister man and the main antagonist of Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn, against her wishes. In order to avoid being put through such misery, she left home to seek her fortunes elsewhere. In [i]Path of Radiance[/i], she is also able to befriend [[Sothe (Fire Emblem)|]], [[Gatrie (Fire Emblem)|]] or [[Makalov (Fire Emblem)|]] via supports, the latter of whom she is infamous for giving undeserved praise in [i]Radiant Dawn[/i].

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Bow Knight (Path of Radiance), Bow Paladin (Radiant Dawn).

She has [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]] and [[amber eyes]], and wears a white [[breastplate]] with [[shoulder pads]] and a [[purple shirt]]. Notably, she bears a strong resemblance to [[Ayra (Fire Emblem)|]], except for different eye colors and armor designs.

h4. Appearance
* !post #7662046: [[Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance]]
* !post #7662060: [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]]
other_names: ステラ(ファイアーエムブレム)

title: shamisen_(suzumiya_haruhi)
body: A [[calico cat]] who usually accompanies [[kyon's sister|Kyon's little sister]]. The name, in turn, comes from the name of [[shamisen|the Japanese traditional three-stringed guitar-like instrument]] which is usually played with a plectrum called a [[bachi]]. Traditionally, skins for shamisens were made using dog or cat skin, with cat skin favored for finer instruments.

The [[esso crumb cat (meme)|]] meme is based on it.

title: goutokuji_mike
body: Lucky Charm for Prosperous Commerce Goutokuji Mike (pronounced "mee-keh") is the 1st stage boss of [[Touhou]] 18 [[Unconnected Marketeers]]. She is a [[Maneki-Neko]] with [[calico (pattern)|]] colorings. With the appearance of a [[cat_girl|humanoid cat]], she has [[short_hair|short]] [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair]] with [[multicolored_hair|several brown and orange stains]] following the calico pattern acomodated in [[bangs]]; same pattern goes in her [[cat_ears|ears]] and [[cat_tail|tail]]. She has [[orange eyes]], and wears a [[crop top]] and a [[medium_skirt|skirt]] all covered in [[patch]]. Off her neck hangs a [[jingle bell]], while on her feet she wears [[barefoot|nothing at all]]. She holds a [[gold|golden]] [[koban_(gold)|koban]] [[coin]], with the words [b]千万両[/b] written in it, meaning in Chinese [i]"ten million tael"[/i], as part of her maneki-neko characterization. She is often drawn with her arms doing a [[paw pose]]. h4. See also * [[Goutokuji Mike (Cat)]] * "Nyan Clan of Gensokyo":/pools/17046 h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Mike_Goutokuji

title: c.cats_uniform_(idolmaster)
body:
C.Cats Uniform is a costume from [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]] worn by the members of [[houkago_climax_girls_(idolmaster)|Houkago Climax Girls ]]. It is associated with the song "Cat Squad".

All five members sport a [[frills|frilled]] [[baseball uniform]] with a [[neck bell]], [[animal_ear_headwear|cat ear headwear]], [[fangs]], [[cat_tail|cat tails]] with [[tail_bow|tail bows]], and [[paw shoes]].

[[Komiya Kaho]]'s version of the costume features a [[cat helmet|cat-eared]] [[baseball helmet]], [[paw gloves]], [[frilled wrist cuffs]], and a [[black_shirt|black]] [[turtleneck shirt]] beneath a [[vertical-striped_shirt|vertical-striped]] [[baseball jersey]] that is [[shirt_partially_tucked_in|partially tucked in]] to [[vertical-striped_shorts|vertical-striped]] [[frilled shorts]]. She wears [[white_socks|white]] [[loose socks]]. Often shown [[holding_baseball_bat|holding]] a [[baseball bat]].

[[Sonoda Chiyoko]]'s version of the costume features a [[cat_hat|cat-eared]] [[baseball cap]], an [[off shoulder]] [[baseball jersey]] with [[frilled_sleeves|frilled]] [[puffy short sleeves]] over a [[black_shirt|black]] [[sleeveless turtleneck]], [[striped_sweatband|striped]] [[sweatband|sweatbands]] on each wrist, a [[baseball mitt]] a [[frilled skirt]], a [[fluffy tail]], two [[frilled_thigh_strap|frilled]] [[thigh_strap|thigh straps]], and [[bandaid|bandaids]] on her [[bandaid_on_knee|right knee]] and [[bandaid_on_leg|left leg]]. She sports an [[alternate hairstyle]], which is a long, [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[low ponytail]] tied with a [[hair bow]] and curled [[sidelocks]].

[[Morino Rinze]]'s version of the costume features a  [[cat helmet|cat-eared]] [[baseball helmet]], [[black_gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[frilled_wrist_cuffs|frilled]] [[wrist cuffs]], and a [[black_shirt|black]] [[sleeveless_turtleneck|sleeveless]] [[turtleneck shirt]] beneath a [[sleeveless_shirt]] [[cropped_shirt|cropped]] [[vertical-striped_shirt|vertical-striped]] [[baseball jersey]] that has [[puffy detached sleeves]]. On the bottom half she wears [[black_shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]] [[bike_shorts_under_skirt|underneath]] a [[high-low skirt]], and [[loose_socks|loose]] [[thighhighs]]. Often shown [[holding_baseball_bat|holding]] a [[baseball bat]]. She sports an [[alternate hairstyle]] and [[alternate hair length]] for this costume, which is a [[wolf cut]].

[[Saijo Juri]]'s version of the costume features a [[cat_hat|cat-eared]] [[backwards hat]], [[baseball mitt]], a [[cropped_shirt|cropped]] [[black_shirt|black]] [[turtleneck shirt]] with [[three-quarter sleeves]] that reveals her [[midriff]] beneath a [[vertical-striped_jacket|vertical-striped]] [[open jacket]] [[baseball jersey]] with a [[frilled shirt collar]], a singular [[striped_sweatband|striped]] [[sweatband]] around her right wrist, a singular [[frilled_wrist_cuffs|frilled]] [[wrist_cuffs|wrist cuff]] around her left wrist, [[black_shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]] [[bike_shorts_under_shorts|underneath]] [[frilled shorts]], and [[blue_socks|blue]] [[loose socks]] underneath [[shin guards]].

[[Arisugawa Natsuha]]'s version of the costume features a [[cat_hat|cat-eared]] [[baseball cap]], a [[baseball mitt]], a [[fluffy tail]], a [[cropped_shirt|cropped]] [[vertical-striped_shirt|vertical-striped]] [[baseball jersey]] with [[frilled sleeves]] and is [[tied_shirt|tied at the front]] to expose her [[midriff]]. This is worn over a [[black shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], and she wears a singular [[frilled_wrist_cuffs|frilled]] [[wrist_cuffs|wrist cuff]] around her left wrist. She wears [[fishnets]] beneath [[vertical-striped_shorts|vertical-striped]] [[short shorts]] and she wears [[frilled thighhighs]] [[socks_over_fishnets|over them]]. She sports an [[alternate hairstyle]], which is a long, [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[low ponytail]] tied with a [[hair scrunchie]].

title: marina_(fear_&_hunger)
body:
One of the playable characters and recruitable party members of [[Fear & Hunger 2: Termina]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair|brown]] or [[grey hair]] and [[mouth_piercing|mouth piercings]]. She wears a [[white shirt]] with a [[frilled shirt collar]] and [[long sleeves]], a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[pink skirt]], [[white socks]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[mary janes]].

Her skills include engraving sigils on party members' faces for stat bonuses. 

[spoiler]Her moonscorched form is the [[cocoon_(fear_&_hunger)|Cocoon]].[/spoiler]

[spoiler]She was born male but was raised as a woman by her mother to protect her from the life and obligations of a dark priest. As such, she identifies herself as female.[/spoiler]

title: third-party_source
body:
A post sourced from any site other than the original artist or (official) source provider. This includes instances of [[official art]] and [[game CG]] that are reuploaded elsewhere online.

Typically, this is a post sourced to another imageboard, booru, or wiki, rather than to the original artist.

This tag can also be applied if a post is sourced from an account who steals and reposts drawings from other artists, whether intentional or unintentional. Be cautious when uploading posts from potential art thieves.

h4. See also

* [[non-web source]]
* [[second-party source]]

title: death-x-dorugoramon
body:
An Undead Digimon. Through the mysterious and malevolent process known as "Death-X-Evolution", [[DORUmon]]'s data was made to evolve into a merciless monster. Although it is technically dead, it is still active, as it is essentialy a large mass of DigiCores kept forcibly restrained to its warped body. As a result, it continually preys on DigiCores mindlessly, earning it the fearsome title of "DigiCore Predator" (電脳核捕食者, [i]Dennou Kakko Hoshokusha[/i])

Death-X-DORUgoramon is referred to as [b]DexDorugoramon[/b] in English material.

title: dorugoramon
body: A Beast Dragon Digimon and one of [[DORUmon]]'s final forms. As the Ultimate evolution of a being possessing both Dragon and Beast data within its DigiCore, it manifests itself as a ferocious presence of destruction, although it is often seen as benevolent unless attacked - at which point it is unstoppable; befitting of its title of "Ultimate Enemy" (究極の敵, [i]Kyuukyoku no Teki[/i])

title: justimon
body:
A Cyborg Digimon. It is known as a "Hero of Justice" that inspires all Baby Digimon with its red scarf, and never backs down from a fight in the name of justice. It has the ability to switch out its mechanical right arm into either the massively powerful Accel Arm, the Blitz Arm that can bring down powerful electric bursts, and the hyper cutter Critical Arm to slash through anything. 

It is loosely inspired by [[Riderman]].

title: impmon
body:
A Small Devil Digimon. Impmon are famous pranksters, often playing tricks on people and other Digimon. While it can be mischievous, it rarely means real harm, and will confront stronger Digimon instead of bowing to them. 

Despite being only Child-level, it is said that Impmon can evolve all the way to [[Beelzebumon]] - an Ultimate-level.

body: A Mammal Digimon. It resembles [[Patamon]] but purple. However, its personality is the complete opposite, and it is said to be as vile as [[Impmon]] and [[PicoDevimon]]. It is often summoned in hordes by high-ranking, powerful evil Digimon such as [[Devimon]].

title: sparkle_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]] and in [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] (via crossover event). 

A Masked Fool who follows Aha, the Aeon of Elation. Goes by the name "Hanabi" ("Firework") in Japanese. Voiced by [[Ueda Reina]] (JP) and [[Lizzie Freeman]] (EN). 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied into [[twintails]], [[pink eyes]] with [[butterfly-shaped pupils]], [[small breasts|small]]/[[medium breasts]], and [[facial mark]]s under her eyes. Her default outfit is [[Japanese clothes|Japanese-themed]] and comprises a [[black choker]] with a [[jingle bell]], [[red dress]] with [[detached sleeves]], dark purple [[obi]], [[black gloves]], [[red footwear|red]] [[sandals]], and a [[fox mask]].

h4. Costumes

* !post #7691414: Splash art (referred to as "Thousand-Faced Maestro: Cameo" for [[Honkai Impact 3rd]])
* !post #7280163: [[Sparkle (School Uniform) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Character trailer school uniform]]
* !post #8768345: [[Sparkle (It's Showtime) (Honkai: Star Rail)|It's Showtime]] red dress
* !post #8337932: [[Sparkle (Fictitious Game) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Fictitious Game]] [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] collab dress

h4. See Also

* [[Sparkle (Doll) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Sparkle's doll]]

title: ranma_1/2
body:
[b]Ranma ½[/b] (らんま½, Ranma Nibun-no-Ichi?, pronounced Ranma One-Half) is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Takahashi Rumiko]] and first published in 1987. The story revolves around a 16-year old boy named Ranma Saotome who was trained from early childhood in martial arts. As a result of an accident during a training journey, he is cursed to become a girl when splashed with cold water, but hot water will change him back into a boy. It has two anime adaptations, one originally made in 1989, and a newer one from 2024.

h4. Characters

title: asajj_ventress
body: Asajj Ventress (/əˈsɑːʒ ˈvɛntrəs/) is a character in the [[Star Wars]] franchise created by [[George Lucas]]. She was introduced in Genndy Tartakovsky's 2003 animated series [[Star Wars: Clone Wars]] (voiced by Grey DeLisle). The character later appeared in the 2008 animated film [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]], the 2008 television series of the same name, and the 2021 Disney+ series [[Star Wars: The Bad Batch]] (voiced by Nika Futterman)

title: shaymin_(land)
body:
[[Shaymin]] ([b]Land Forme[/b]), from [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i].

In this form, Shaymin is a small, white [[hedgehog]]-like Pokémon. It has green grass-like fur on its back and a pink flower with two leaves on each side of its head, which resembles the Gracidea flower.

title: segawa_onpu
body:
[[Ojamajo Doremi]] character.

A child idol with [[purple eyes]] who wears her [[purple hair]] in a [[side ponytail]] or a [[one side up]].

Usually wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]] with [[short sleeves]] under a [[purple dress|purple]] [[pinafore dress]] with [[purple shorts]] underneath and [[yellow shoes|yellow]] [[sneakers]].

Her purple-themed [[magical girl]] uniform consists of a [[dress]], [[purple boots|purple]] [[knee boots]] with [[pointy boots|pointy tips]], [[purple gloves]], a [[purple hat|purple]] [[witch hat]] and [[earrings]].

[[Roro (ojamajo doremi)|]] is her fairy partner.

title: harukaze_poppu
body:
[[Ojamajo Doremi]] character. [[Harukaze Doremi]]'s little [[sisters|sister]].

Pop has [[pink eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]] that she wears as [[two side up]]. 

Usually wears a [[blue shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], [[white ribbon|white]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[pink skirt]], [[pink socks]] and [[blue shoes|blue]] [[sneakers]].

Her [[magical girl]] outfit consists of [[earrings]], a [[red hat|red]] [[witch hat]], [[red gloves]], [[red dress]] and [[red boots|red]] [[boots]] with [[pointy boots|pointy tips]].

title: senoo_aiko
body:
[[Ojamajo Doremi]] character.

An Osaka girl with [[blue eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] and an [[ahoge]].

Usually wears a [[green shirt|green]] [[t-shirt]] with [[short sleeves]] under [[blue overalls]], [[grey jacket|grey]] [[sleeveless jacket]], and [[grey shoes|grey]] [[shoes]].

Her [[magical girl]] uniform consists of a [[blue dress]], [[blue boots|blue]] [[knee boots]] with [[pointy boots|pointy tips]], [[blue gloves]], [[blue hat|blue]] [[witch hat]], and [[earrings]].

[[Mimi (ojamajo doremi)|]] is her fairy partner.

title: fujiwara_hazuki
body:
[[Ojamajo Doremi]] character. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[short bangs]], [[brown eyes]], and wears an [[orange bow|orange]] [[hair bow]] and [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]].

Usually wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with [[short sleeves]], a [[yellow vest]], an [[orange skirt|orange]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white socks]] and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]].

In her [[magical girl]] form, she wears an [[orange hat|orange]] [[witch hat]], [[orange dress]], [[orange boots|orange]] [[knee boots]] with [[pointy boots|pointy tips]] and [[orange gloves]], as well as [[earrings]].

[[Rere (ojamajo doremi)|]] is her fairy partner.

title: harukaze_doremi
body:
The protagonist of [[Ojamajo Doremi]]. Called [b]Dorie Goodwin[/b] in the English dub.


She has [[pink eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]] that she wears in [[double bun]]s.

Usually wears a [[purple shirt|purple]] [[t-shirt]] with [[short sleeves|short]] [[pink sleeves]], [[grey shorts]], [[white socks]] and [[sneakers]].

In her [[magical girl]] form, she wears a [[pink hat|pink]] [[witch hat]], [[pink boots|pink]] [[knee boots]] with [[pointy boots|pointy tips]], [[pink gloves]], a [[pink dress]] and [[earrings]]. 
She is sometimes seen wearing a [[musical note hair ornament]]. 

[[Dodo (ojamajo doremi)|]] is her fairy partner.
other_names: ドリー・グッドウィン

title: misono_karin_(halloween_ver.)
body:
An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Misono Karin]] in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. As the name suggests, it is a [[Halloween costume]].

Her [[medium hair|medium]] [[purple hair]] is tied into [[two side up]] using [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow|bows]]. She also has [[sidelocks]], [[parted bangs]] and [[purple eyes]].

She wears a [[pumpkin hat|pumpkin]] [[hat]] with [[frilled hat|frills]], a [[candle]], a [[star print|star]] [[print hat|print]] and a [[wide brim]], a [[black choker|black]] [[bow choker|bow]] [[choker]] with a [[star choker|star]] [[pendant choker|pendant]], an [[orange shirt|orange]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[shirt]] with [[cross-laced shirt|cross-lacing]] and [[center frills|center]] [[frilled shirt|center frills]], a [[black cape|black]][[two-tone cape|-and-]][[purple cape|purple]] [[two-sided cape|two-sided]] [[cape]], a pair of [[black gloves|black]] [[gloves]], a [[black belt|black]] [[belt]], an [[orange skirt|orange]] [[bubble skirt|bubble]] [[miniskirt]] with [[frilled skirt|frills]], a [[spider web print|spider web]] [[print skirt|print]] and [[vertical-striped skirt|vertical stripes]], [[black thighhighs|black]][[two-tone thighhighs|-and-]][[purple thighhighs|purple]] [[striped thighhighs|striped]] [[thighhighs]] and [[black boots|black]] [[pointy boots|pointy]] [[boots]] with [[frilled footwear|frills]] and [[cross-laced footwear|cross-lacing]].

title: serpent_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]], her name is read as 'Nacha' / 'Na Qia' in-game by the Japanese/Chinese dub, but localised as 'Serpent'. Voiced by [[Sakura Kaoru (voice actor)|]].

An S class Sinner, an [[acrobatics]] performer of the Phantom Entertainment, her body developed snake-like features such as [[pointy ears]], [[slit pupils]], [[forked tongue]] and [[scales]] on her shoulder and legs. She owns a [[giant snake]] as a pet and uses a hollow [[ball and chain|ball chained]] to a [[kama (weapon)|]] as her weapon. Her alignment is Love.

Serpent has [[grey eyes]] with [[slit pupils]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[blue hair|blue]]/[[aqua hair]] in the style of [[low twintails]] ([[low-tied long hair]]) tied together with two [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]]s, typically depicted with [[hair over one eye]]. Wears a [[black hat|black]] and [[white hat|white]] [[two-tone hat|two tone]] [[party hat]], two black hair bows and one [[white bow|white hair bow]], and a pair of [[star earrings]] on her ears.

She wears a [[black dress|black]] and [[white dress|white]] [[two-tone dress]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]] and [[black shorts|black]] [[shorts under dress]], the dress itself has long [[crinoline]]. Wears [[mismatched legwear]], right leg has a [[white thighhighs|white]] [[argyle thighhighs|argyle]] [[single thighhigh]] while the left leg wears a [[vertical-striped socks|vertical-striped]] [[single kneehigh]], she wears a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[pointy shoes]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #20131691: Mugshot
* !asset #20131693: Default
* !asset #20131694: Phase 3 
* !asset #20131696: [[Serpent (Awaken from Slumber) (path to nowhere)|Awaken from Slumber]]
* !asset #20131698: [[KFC]] collaboration attire, unavailable in Global

h4. External links

* "S1N Wiki: Serpent":[https://s1n.gg/sinner/serpent]

title: kurosu_aroma
body:
Character from the series [[Pripara]].

Aroma has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]]. Outside of PriPara, she wears a [[pink hairband]] with [[bat wings]] [[wing hair ornament|attached to it]], a [[purple capelet]] and [[Paprika Private Academy school uniform]].

Her main PriPara costume consists of pink [[demon horns]], a [[blue hat|blue]] [[mini witch hat]] with a [[purple bow]] [[hat bow|on the side]], a [[purple dress]] with a [[pink ribbon]], a [[blue collar]], a [[blue belt]], [[layered skirt]] with [[frilled skirt|frills]], [[blue gloves]], a [[demon tail]], [[striped thighhighs|striped]] [[purple thighhighs]] and [[pointy boots|pointy]] [[purple boots|purple]] [[boots]] with a [[pink bow]] attached to them.

title: asuka_momoko
body:
[[Ojamajo Doremi]] character.

A Japanese-born girl who grew up in America. She has [[green eyes]], and wears her [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] in [[hair rings]].

Usually wears a [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[orange shirt]] with [[short sleeves]] with a [[white skirt|white]] [[suspender skirt]], [[black socks]] and [[white shoes|white]] [[sneakers]].

She wears [[earrings]] and a [[yellow dress|yellow]] [[dress]], [[yellow gloves]], [[yellow boots|yellow]] [[knee boots]] with [[pointy boots|pointy tips]] and [[yellow hat|yellow]] [[witch hat]] as her [[magical girl]] uniform.

[[Nini (ojamajo doremi)|]] is her fairy partner.

title: makihatayama_hana
body:
Character from [[Ojamajo Doremi]].

She at first appears as a [[baby]], and ties her hair with [[hair bobbles]].

When she grows up, she has [[brown eyes]] and [[very long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied into [[low twintails]].

Usually wears a [[wing hair ornament]], a [[white shirt]] [[floral print|decorated with flowers]], [[blue shorts|blue]] [[short shorts|shorts]] and [[orange shoes]].

She wears a [[magical girl]] uniform consisting of a [[white dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], [[white boots|white]] [[knee boots]] with [[high heels]] and [[pointy boots|pointy tips]], [[white gloves]], a [[white hat]] and [[earrings]]. Also wears a [[pink bag|pink]] [[backpack]] with [[winged bag|wings attached]] which look like [[white wings]] when seen from the front.

[[Toto (ojamajo doremi)|]] is her fairy partner.

title: shake_king
body:
Main antagonist and final boss of [[Wario Land: Shake it!]] 

A pirate that commands a legion of [[Bandinero]]s. He attempted to take over the Shake Dimension, stole the Bottomless Coin Sack, imprisoned the [[Merfle (wario land)|]]s and kidnapped [[Queen Merelda]].

His design parallels that of [[Wario]]'s, exhibiting [[beard|facial hair]], a blue ring around his eyes, big [[muscular male|muscular]] arms, a rotund body, stubby legs and [[pointy shoes]].

title: yuntouxie
body: A type of traditional Chinese shoe with an upturned toe, usually [[pointy shoes|pointy]]. They are often intricately embroidered.

title: shoes
body:
A covering for the foot, typically with a sturdy sole and a soft upper half, with the cuff not reaching above the ankle.

This tag generally includes any type of closed shoe less than ankle-height, including [[sneakers]], [[loafers]], [[Mary Janes]], [[high heels]], etc. It does not include other types of shoes, such as [[boots]], [[sandals]], [[slippers]], etc, that either go past the ankle, don't cover the whole foot, or aren't made of sturdy material.

title: shisui_kiki_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[Nanashi Inc.]]'s [[Shisui Kiki]], as seen in post #6535067.

She has both an [[ahoge]] and a [[cowlick]], a [[high ponytail]] held with a [[butterfly hair ornament]], [[crossed bangs]], and [[sidelocks]]. Her costume consists of a [[revealing clothes|revealing]] [[short dress|short]] [[backless dress|backless]] and [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[black dress]] [[open dress|open at the front]] showing her [[navel]] and an [[underbust]], with small [[frilled dress|frills]] on the bottom. On her neck is a [[detached collar|detached]] [[white collar]] and a thin [[grey necktie]] that goes between her [[necktie between breasts|breasts]]. Her arms have [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[multicolored sleeves]] of [[white sleeves|white]] [[purple sleeves|purple]] and [[black sleeves|black]] with a [[yellow belt|yellow]] [[arm belt]] and a [[purple bow|purple]] [[sleeve bow]] that go past [[sleeves past fingers|her fingers]]. She also wears a [[grey skirt|grey]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[microskirt]], and an [[o-ring thigh strap]] with [[two-tone boots|two-tone]] [[black boots|black]] and [[white boots|white]] [[high heel boots]] with purple [[footwear bows|bows]].

title: rinkou_ashelia_(lia_3.0)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Phase Connect]]'s [[Rinkou Ashelia]].

It's a [[tenshi kaiwai]]/[[punk]] inspired costume, consisting of [[fake wings|fake]] [[head wings]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]] with [[belt]]s forming a [[criss-cross halter]] and [[mismatched sleeves|mismatched]] [[detached sleeves]] (the left sleeve having [[black sleeves|black]] and [[white sleeves|white]] [[striped sleeves|stripes]] and the right being [[blue sleeves|blue]]), [[white bloomers]] with blue [[frills]] and a [[black belt]], [[torn leggings|torn]] and [[mismatched legwear|mismatched leggings]], [[white leg warmers]] with [[fake wings]] on the ankles and [[blue shoes|blue]] [[two-tone shoes|and]] [[white shoes|white]] [[sneakers]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has her hair cut in a [[wolf cut]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[short hair with long locks|chest-length locks]] and bangs [[hair over one eye|covering her left eye]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8388757: Reference sheet

title: arch_bishop_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The Third Job of the [[Priest (ragnarok online)|]]/[[High Priest (ragnarok online)|]] tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Can use a [[holding mace|mace]], [[holding book|book]], or [[holding staff|staff]]. 


h4. Original Appearance
* !post #7301320
* !post #7301341
Males wear a [[black choker]] [[cross choker|with]] the [[Cross of Prontera]], a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[white jacket]] over a [[blue coat]] with [[long sleeves]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves]], a [[cross necklace]], [[white pants]], and [[black shoes|black]]-[[two-tone shoes]]-[[white shoes|white]] [[shoes]]. 
Females wear a [[blue dress|blue]]-[[two-tone dress|and]]-[[white dress]] with a [[cleavage]] [[cleavage cutout|cutout]] and [[juliet sleeves]], [[cross]]es on the shoulders and chest, a [[yellow sash]], [[white thighhighs|white]] [[fishnet thighhighs]] with [[frilled thighhighs|frills]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]]. 


h4. [[Official alternate costume|Second Costume]]
* !post #7306175
* !post #7306176
Males wear a similar outfit to their original costume, but a [[white capelet]], a [[gold trim|gold-trimmed]] [[black shirt]], and the coat now [[open coat|open]].
Females also wear a close outfit, but now their [[frilled dress|dress]] is [[frilled sleeves|frilled]] with [[yellow bow|yellow]] [[dress bow]]s,

title: warlock_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The Third Job of the [[Wizard (ragnarok online)|]]/[[High Wizard (ragnarok online)|]] tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Can equip a [[holding staff|staff]] or a [[holding wand|wand]], but sometimes are seen with a [[holding book|book]]. 

h4. Original Appearance
* !post #7301264
* !post #7301281
Males wear an [[open coat|open]] [[grey coat]] over a [[black bodysuit]] which itself is over a [[white shirt]] and [[black pants]], [[black gloves]] with [[chain]]s attached, and [[black shoes|black]] [[shoes]]. 
Females wear a similar outfit but instead of a bodysuit, they wear a [[crop top|cropped]] [[white shirt]], [[suspenders]] on their [[pants]] with a [[front slit]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[yellow shoes|yellow]] [[high heels]].


h4. [[Official alternate costume|Second Costume]]
* !post #7306155
* !post #7306157
Males wear a [[brown cape|brown]] [[two-sided cape|and]] [[red cape|red]] [[fur-trimmed cape]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[two-tone shirt|and]] [[white shirt]] with [[gold trim|gold-trimmed]] [[long sleeves|sleeves]], [[black gloves]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[two-tone shoes|and]] [[white shoes|white]] [[shoes]].
Females wear a [[black cape|black]] [[two-sided cape|and]] [[red cape|red]] [[fur-trimmed cape]], a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] [[two-tone dress|and]] [[white dress]] with a [[fur-trimmed dress|fur trim]], [[black gloves]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[two-tone thighhighs|and]] [[white thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], and [[yellow sandals|yellow]] [[sandals]].

title: lucas_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Lucas[/b], known as [b]Kouki[/b] (コウキ) in Japan, is the male player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon dppt|Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

This Trainer is from Sandgem Town in the Sinnoh region. With a kind soul and strong sense of justice, he’s also an assistant to Professor Rowan, the authority on Pokémon Evolution [tn](official bio)[/tn].

He has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]]. He wears an [[orange hat|orange]] [[poke ball print|print]] [[beret]], an [[orange scarf]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeve]] [[shirt]], a [[black vest]], a [[bracelet]], a [[poketch|Pokétch]], [[grey pants|grey]] [[baggy pants]], and [[orange shoes|orange]] [[two-tone shoes|and]] [[grey shoes|grey]] [[shoes]].

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Diamond[/b] who often looks [[sleepy]] and eats [[food]].
